Adversity only makes him more determined to paint, and paint he does: more than 100 portraits in a four month span. We first encounter Imber in his studio for the first time painting with his left hand while he and his partner, painter Jill Hoy, analyze Jon's self-portrait and talk about the anxiety to come. The painting becomes an unsettling metaphor of his psychological journey living into his dying through his art.

Isabelle and Will drive to a park, leave the car and have sex. The father follows in his car, but falls into a delirium again. This is a documentary about one man's unbreakable spirit. Presenting a snapshot of gay attitudes to body image and how no-one persecutes a minority quite like a persecuted minority. 'Being Stavros' is a tale of triumph, heartbreak and how to wear your underpants.

Through the use of experimental sound design, and increasingly intimate cinematography, Deafblind Couple illustrates the simultaneous deep isolation and true moments of connection between its two characters.

His orders are to stop a deadly plot, one which could send us all back to the dark ages, from hatching. An intensely humorous, deeply romantic and nerve-racking epic tale unfolds. Battling with scars of war in Lagos, he runs a small security company with a fellow war veteran.Its election time and a powerful politician hands his firm a lucrative contract as honey a young prostitute abruptly enters Obi's life Relentless explores Lagos, dangerous and uncompromising, fraught with corruption yet thriving with hope and resilience, bustling with energy and vibrancy

title: The Devotion Project: Foremost in my Mind
des: The Devotion Project is a series of short documentary portraits celebrating LGBTQ love. Gail Marquis, an Olympic medalist (Montreal '76), met Audrey Smaltz when she was 43 and Smaltz, a former model, was 61. They'd each had other relationships, Marquis with women and Smaltz with men, but until they met it had never 'clicked.' Smaltz, an entrepreneur who works in fashion, didn't miss a beat when telling friends about her new love, and they soon became inseparable. Their story will resonate with the 'late bloomers' among us as it tracks the course of these women's incredible lives, each rich with accomplishment, and celebrates their love story.

title: Mudita

He befriends an older stand up comedienne KGB or Katyayini Ganapati Bhat who brings some humor and meaning into his life. Hell bent on getting him married his mother tries to set up an arranged marriage for him with an equally awkward but seemingly abrasive girl subbalakshmi with whom he feels an immediate connection. After many years away, Sarah, his ex Fiance returns to Bangalore with her two kids to get away from her abusive husband. 'The chief ruiner of my life' as Panda calls her cant help but think of giving their relationship a second chance. He's looking for love, he's looking for a true beacon of hope for his otherwise hopeless and loveless life destined for the mundane. Here he is confronted by various aspects of the life he left behind, including his overbearing mother. Together with all the complex relationships in his life, Panda learns to heal his old wounds and forges new friendships.

Feeling a sense of responsibility for abandoning his past, Miles must get over his animosity towards the town if he wants to make a difference. Can Sam banish them from his life before they ruin his chances with the newfound girl of his dreams? Swaying delicately between dry wit and wistful vulnerability, "Another Girl" playfully explores the way our relationships shape who we are, and offers a fresh perspective on sex, love, and self-acceptance.

And can she save her husband?

title: Pain Love & Passion
des: What would you do if you only have a few years to live? Have you ever though about it? Unfortunately, Miguel has no other choice. Inspired by true events, is the story about a young man diagnosed with a brain malformation. Due to his infliction, he's told he won't live beyond the age of 30. And with that news, Miguel realizes that he's got to get the one that got away. In the midst of that pursuit, he finds himself embroiled in drama with his childhood friend Jason, his present girlfriend and he continues to make enemies along the way. In turn it's the unwanted drama, which brings on the stress, that causes the headaches, which worsen his condition. Cheating, lying and a love triangle set the stage for this dramatic film, and at the end of the day Miguel endures it all...Pain Love & Passion!

Behind Charlie is Angus, an unassuming puppeteer who has taken his job home with him. At first Em believes Charlie is just a catharsis for Angus but when the man operating the puppet begins to communicate to her secretly behind the puppets back she starts to question, who is who and who is real and is she falling in love with the man or the puppet?

Kerley presents proof positive that the intellectual striving that has sparked previous generations, despite what some may say, is alive and well in America.

He is a writer and he came from LA to participate in his new book launch, which most likely is a bestseller. His agent and his assistant went back to California the previous day, as he decided to stay in New York for a while. Chloe says that she will help him.

He returns to a life of solitude and dry, prickly equations. He's still no closer to fixing his equation. Awen visits with a tin of cookies. Paul has a flash of insight, arranges the cookies like a jigsaw puzzle, and discovers the solution to his mathematical problem. But he also discovers the possibility of romance. He just needed to look at things in a different way.

title: Unconditional
des: It's been a year since camera crews were allowed into the home of Michael Foster and Brian Patterson, a homosexual couple celebrating their life together by having a commitment ceremony right in their own back yard. 'Unconditional' explores the lives of these two men and the friends and family they share over the course of two days in Sanford, Florida and sheds light on the one thing no law passed can prevent... unconditional love. Featuring music from top 40 GLBT artist Rachel Sage and alternative folk musician Harold Crisman, this is the first professional documentary release from director/editor Gabriel Haze since his graduation from college in February of 2010. His first two music video releases in 2009, Dagnese's 'Come Over After' and Elizabeth June's 'Freedom', together have won 40+ awards and official selections worldwide.
cast: Gabriel Haze

title: Stalker Party Tonight!
des: Dedicated to the silent short comedies of Chaplin and Keaton, a young woman embarks on a journey to invite the object of her psychotic obsession to a "Stalker Party".

Until the big day arrives, and they find out that Larissa, Vic's girlfriend, is actually a puppet. But the perfect relationship Vic and Larissa appear to have makes Danny and Erin realise just how flawed their own relationship truly is...

John lives in the past, pining for his lost love, Sara, and prevents himself from feeling any emotion because it is too much to bear. John slowly, through several therapy sessions and encounters with Sara, realizes that time does not stand still. And, it is now time for John to take responsibility for his actions. John opens his heart and awaits to receive his final judgment

Now in her early twenties, and less gullible, she's starting to have second thoughts. The shopping trip is supposed to be a test of her loyalty, but the real test comes when she runs into an old high school flame, and finds herself slipping back into the identity she tried so hard to erase.

title: Dregs
des: When the signal hit electricity ceased and everyone became 'Statics'. They stand frozen, ears torn from their heads, eyes white, screaming silently. They respond violently to sound, destroying it with inhuman ferocity. Until it rains! Then the signal is weakened, the power returns and they collapse, screaming. The sole survivors were the heroin addicts, the 'Dregs'. Heroin cancels out the signal as long as they continue to take it. Addict lovers Ben and Zoe must leave their flat to find their missing friends who went searching for a drug impound. Avoiding the 'Salvationists'; an addict-cult who believe they are 'the chosen ones', they must cross the lethal, silent city, where they hope to find their friends and enough heroin to escape to the country forever.
cast: Jamie Blackley, Kathryn Prescott, M.P. Wolff, Rachael Evelyn

title: Miss Hallee and Mr Milliken
des: Miss Kate Hallee isn't your ordinary lady. She travels the country playing many parts, catching the bad guys, saving the good. She's smart, classy. Strong, confident. Honest, funny. Dances to her own tune. Oh, but don't ever cross her because she's Miss Kate Hallee, FBI Special Agent "Extraordinaire", and you don't want to be on her bad side. After she and her team of FBI Agents capture the notorious con-artist womanizing murderer, Malcolm Scathers, Kate heads to beautiful Jekyll Island, Georgia, for a long overdue vacation away from everyone. That is until Oliver Milliken, a handsome gentleman arrives with a smile for her and seems to be every where she is when she is. When finally a full day goes by undisturbed for her, she is certain he has left the hotel. That is until she signs up for a one evening only introductory class in ballroom dancing at the hotel and stands face to face with her assigned dance partner - Him - Mr. Oliver Milliken. Suddenly she is whisked away and taken in by his deep blue eyes, the way he gracefully moves when they dance, even the scent of his skin. It all seems so oddly and wonderfully familiar, and yet Kate feels an intense anger toward him. But how could all this be? They just met. Suddenly for the first time in her life Miss Kate Hallee is thrust into a mystery of her own and the answers she must find out for herself. But all her skills, talents and training as Kate Hallee FBI Special Agent could never prepare her for what was soon to reveal itself to her.
cast: Mario Bruard, Tony Candell, Sandy Deem, Flynn Doyle

When new student, Jerry Renault (Garrett Hnatiuk), refuses to participate, Obie attempts to persuade him to sell the chocolates. Obie and Jerry begin a secret romance, though Jerry continues to refuse to sell. As Obie witnesses the Vigils escalate their bullying and harassment tactics against Jerry, she is forced to examine her involvement with the elite group that once protected her, but that now seems ready to destroy everyone she cares about.

title: Side A Side B
des: During a 44 hour long train journey from Guwahati to Mumbai, guitarist Aiban Joel Gogoi and his singer girlfriend Shivi realise they are headed in opposite directions. Side A Side B, a real world musical structured like a music album, features eight songs, performed and recorded live on the train. The film, hence, plays out in eight scenes (apart from the Intro and the Bonus Track in the opening and closing credits) shot with two phone cameras in eight long takes. The musical juxtaposes two contrasting worlds and perspectives employing two contrasting narratives from the 90s. The sacred realism of the Dogme narrative (preserved by long takes and live music on location) is intercut with the time and space jumping aesthetic of the music video narrative. The young musician-actors have sung and performed all songs themselves and the music director plays the musical narrator of the film. Most of the film was shot on the Kamakhya Express that departed Guwahati on July 7th night by an eight people guerrilla unit in 44 hours.
cast: Rahul Rajkhowa, Shivranjani Singh

title: My Butterfly
des: A tragic love story, inspired by the music and times of Maria Callas, this 1950's period piece plays like an opera. Jack, a handsome young man meets Maria, a beautiful writer, and the two develop a relationship that parallels the intensity of the accompanying sound track of arias, mainly sung by Maria Callas. The situation is complicated when their relationship is challenged by a highly intense, powerful, and stunning young woman Eve, who appears on the scene.

title: Absolutely Positive
des: Absolutely Positive is a dramatic short film that follows four characters, all from different walks of life, as they get tested for HIV. It shows the events of why they decide to get tested, the thoughts that run through their minds as they wait for their results, and how they decide to live their lives after discovering their results. Displaying a truthful insight into the many worlds and faces of HIV, Absolutely Positive sheds light on the importance of personal accountability as well as lack of discrimination, showing that HIV has no limits and knows no bounds. It only takes one person and only one time.

des: A young, unassuming girl goes on a murderous rampage to try and 'purify' the technologically advanced modern society. She is calculated and rational: every step she takes is thought about ten times before it's taken. Little gives her hope in such a despicably preoccupied world except for the one person who has managed to earn her trust. When he betrays her in a familiar way, she must take drastic measures. Symbolic and provoking, '8.3' is an important social commentary on what our society has become and how to deal with it.

Everything slows down after a visit from a close female friend from school. He is not the same person that he once was, doesn't have time for the little things anymore. She doesn't know if she should be concerned. Through selling flowers, he meets a cast of characters who will ultimately decide what man he will become.

One evening, Cass's very patient and loyal best friend, Samantha, brings Cass to a lesbian party, in an effort to get laid and to get Cass out of the house. At the party, Cass, who is supposed to be Sam's wing-girl, meets Amanda, a mysterious and intriguing party-goer who nobody actually invited. Amanda attempts to seduce Cass, and although Cass is intrigued, it's very clear that she's still hung up on Greg. Amanda convinces Cass to confront Greg, but when she does, she discovers something nobody saw coming.

title: Only a Number
des: This is a true story of the struggle to survive, to love and to remember. My mother is a Holocaust survivor with dementia. Over thirty years ago, she documented the horrors she endured at the hands of the Nazis and how she met my father in a concentration camp, separated by barbed wire, physically, and psychologically ravaged by starvation and brutality. And yet, they fell in love, giving each other the strength and will to survive. I visit the sites of the ghettos, concentration and labor camps as they are today, finding visual remnants of the past in the present. What lies within the tangles of my mother's memory, lies beneath these locations that time may have changed, but can never erase. Come with me.
cast: M. Katrin Daria

title: Life of Hers
des: Life of Hers is a web series reflecting the lives and friendships of four millennials in a cosmopolitan city. It explores the complexities of life as a young woman of the African diaspora and some of the unique conflicts that can arise between inherited traditions and assimilated new cultures.

Afraid of failing as a wife and a step-mom, Lisa slowly confronts her fears as she preps for the wedding. She awkwardly stumbles through cake tastings, an engagement party, a last minute breast exam and a huge performance as her alter ego, Dr. Lisa, a week before her wedding. As Lisa embraces marriage she overcomes her self doubt and cynicism, while ultimately learning that she's capable of giving and receiving love.

Soon after the film production starts the line between film and reality begins to blur and the hero has to decide between being a real life hero or reel hero. A situational comedy which turns the concept of true love and the process of film making on its head spinning into a hilarious adventure leading to a startling climax. This is a movie within a movie. with no vulgarity. it is a clean film which can be watched with family. HosaPrem is a unique romantic comedy Assamese movie. The theme/concept of the movie has never been explored in cinemas worldwide, making it a first of its kind Romantic comedy Cinema in the whole world.

Hoffman remains the manipulative (and jealous) voice of reason, as Chris's self-confidence grows with Claudia's encouragement. Women Doors Fanclub Sleepover Meeting. title: Always

cast: LaDios Muhammad, Lennox Williams, Kevin White, Allie Whitten

title: Revenant
des: James and Marion are a couple living a conflicted relationship. James dies abruptly but his body remains undiscoverable. Marion comes back to their country house for the funeral anniversary. She doesn't believe in his death and will end up finding him back, in her dreams or in reality...
cast: Ana Cecilia Stieglitz, Neyssan Falahi, Lucy Campbell, James Augustus Lee

title: The Proposal
des: If you're going to propose, you might as well make a production out of it.
cast: Keith Boynton, Madelyne Camera, Brigitte Choura, Joshua Conkel

title: Continental Drift
des: Croatia, 1999. Adele, a young Australian woman travels by the sea, staying in an abandoned building, amid echoes of war. She meets Antonija, whose life has been fractured by the conflicts that tore apart the former-Yugoslavia, and together they discover the uncanny intimacy that can develop between strangers. This delicate atmospheric drama reveals the private idiosyncrasies of traveling alone, and the bittersweet poignancy of ephemeral romance.
cast: Hilary Park, Claudia Greenstone, James Monarski, Alec K

title: Ying and Yang
des: Masculinity. Femininity. Pansexuality. The inner thoughts of a young man named Devin as he tries to get a grip on his identity, his sexuality, and his relationships. This piece is entirely spoken word. No dialogue. Just poetry. Sexuality comes; sometimes as an intense and life changing discovery. But what happens when you might be confused about your sexuality? When you realize you are attracted to men and women? When you realize one captivates you more than the other? Should you choose? What makes you happy? Him? Her? Or you?
cast: Chivonne Michelle, Derrick L. Middleton, Calvin M. Thompson, Amelia Workman

title: The Enemy, Myself
des: The Enemy, Myself is a visual adaptation of a lyrical work by Suicidal Tendencies entitled 'Institutionalized'. The film is a young film maker's perspective of the dark recesses of misunderstood and untreated mental illness, loss, grief, identity confusion, suicide, and the void that is left for those that remain in our dimension.
cast: Alec Hank, Joseph Kester, Jade Martino, Christoph Roofe

title: For Sarah
des: For Sarah follows Sarah Jordan in the wake of her boyfriends death. She was the last person to see him alive and two days later, she remains the only person to have seen him dead. Alone together in their small apartment Sarah finds herself besieged by the demons of her past. Eventually she makes her first steps into the outside world but as the past meshes with the present, memories with dreams and fantasy, has Sarah finally lost whatever grip she had on reality.
cast: George Bracebridge, Louise Cargin, Johnny Daly, Grace Fitzgerald

title: Higher Education
des: No parents, No money, No hygiene... not all lessons are learned in the classroom. Higher Education is a quirky, fast paced, coming of age comedy. Seen though the eyes of sheltered mummy's boy Martin, we meet his new housemates, Chloe, Jamie and Adam, and follow their highs and lows as they learn to look after themselves. If you already had a low opinion of students, its just about to get a whole lot worse!
cast: Tansy Adair, James Bisp, Nathan Cable, Antonia Christophers

title: $weethearts
des: Hal, a down on his luck, lovesick thief decides to rob a bank to pay the bills. You can imagine his surprise when he finds his backstabbing, ex girlfriend, Cheryl, robbing the same bank at the same time. They will need each other to get the money, but can Hal avoid falling back in love?
cast: Grant Mahnken, Annika Noelle, Diana Varco, William A. Majors

title: Time
des: Devastated by a breakup, a frustrated boxer needs to focus on winning the biggest fight of his life while his cheating ex-girlfriend desperately wants to mend their relationship.
cast: Jennifer Allcott, Paul Alwill, Owen Burke, Robert LaSardo

title: When 2 Worlds Collide
des: Youth is wasted on the young - if they're lucky. Jai like any other teenage boy has ideals and hopes, but has kept them locked up along with everything else he doesn't talk about. Being the son of a single parent smack head and the eldest of his siblings, his dreams have drifted further and further away over the years. Freedom visits briefly in the form of a day out with his 'out of his league' girlfriend Saskia and her friends. But their indulgence is cut short when reality checks in with a thud.
cast: Andy Cameron, Billie Fraser, Garry Jay Fraser, Stephanie Grant

title: The Reliever!
des: When you have a stage 5 Clinger, call The Reliever.
cast: Shane Callahan, Cullen Moss, Summer Rahn

title: Avalon
des: After being jilted at the alter, Rebecca Taylor struggles to move forward with her love life, and encounters more difficulties when her Ex-Fiance returns to the romanticized island to win her back.
cast: Gwenhwyfar Reagan James, Sinead McHugh, Ryan Krause, Chris Roark

title: Deep Playa Sunrise
des: Deep Playa Sunrise is one of the only fictional stories ever allowed to film at Burning Man. On the surface, this simple tale follows a profoundly deaf combat vet, as he searches the festival for hearing-aid batteries. Underneath however, Deep Playa Sunrise, is an attempt to describe the intimate side of Burning Man and unearth some of the very real magic that people encounter once a year. **Deep Playa Sunrise was approved by Burning Man's governing body, Black Rock City, LLC.
cast: Rachel Pringle, Chris Holz

title: Void
des: A young girl addicted to porn develops a crush on a boy in her class.
cast: Sami Cavestani, Henry Fulton Winship

title: Future Dave
des: Dave has an encounter with his Future Self and Alternate Future self all while trying to have sex with his girlfriend. Apparently, the ramifications of this sexual escapade will have far-reaching and complex ramifications.
cast: Amy Hamdoon, Joe Tracini

title: Friends, No Benefits
des: An unusual friendship, in which two friends belonging to different parts of society realize that they must choose what they want out of life, and how far their friendship will accompany them.
cast: Russell Bernal, Suraj Goel, Emily Crighton, Samantha Lozada

title: 2 Girls + a Guy
des: Two girls, of seemingly different backgrounds, with differing intentions, are dating the same guy. They meet and talk and eventually they discover their mutual involvement, but one of them has a secret she is keeping from both the other girl and the guy.
cast: Julie Gribble, Dominick Racano, Casey Holloway, Jackie Goldston

title: The Misteak
des: Chase, in post-mortem narration, pronounces himself dead than proceeds to revisit the dinner preparation and casual date night that resulted in his comic pseudo-death. An indy romantic comedy follows this ADD helpless romantic as he gets a bit carried away and ruins the date of a lifetime yet in the end realizes there are always more fish in the sea.
cast: Casey Dolkas, Ellie Eversole, Erica Eynon, Jessica Granger

title: Nick of Time
des: A young man stumbles upon a unique way to avoid getting dumped by his girlfriend.
cast: Dana Davis, Nicholas Strong

title: Love in an INSTAnt
des: Love In An INSTAnt follows the beginning, middle and end of a relationship as it all plays out on Instagram.
cast: Daphne Duplaix, Gabrielle Collins, Stefany Baclaan, Josh Ferguson

title: When She Smiles
des: When She Smiles is a fresh unique blend of cinema and spoken word poetry. This short film explores the intricate beauty of same sex love, even against the odds. Love is hard, but it gets better.
cast: Shannon Dae, Hudson Sheaffer, Angel M. Wainwright, Yazmin Monet Watkins

title: The Most Beautiful Girl
des: Eight year old Martin falls in love with Lisa when she tells him he's cute. He follows her around the playground until he blurts out that he loves her then runs away. But Lisa has a boyfriend, Steven, who wants him to leave her alone.
cast: Cameron Sheean, Morgan Rose, Jonah Kellams, Amanda Vasconcellos

title: Olu & Daria
des: Olu and Daria is a film about a sexually inexperienced college male who struggles to act on the advances of a more experienced female in fear of revealing his naivety.
cast: David Glover, Holly Heneks, Mohamed Kasim, Nicole Lockley

title: Romeo & His Juliet
des: Carl Richards', a renowned and praised Broadway director, turns uncomfortably in his shoes during rehearsals with his lead actors on the Eve of 'Romeo and Juliet'; his version of the beloved Shakespere classic. With a little under 24hrs to opening night, his lead actors seem to have tension between each other as Kara (the lead actress had become alarmingly and emotionally distant from everyone... but why? With his Wife playing the lead and judging by the way Carl looks at her... It seems that Carl may know more that meets the eye...
cast: Peter Danzig, John Schultz, Julia Trinidad

title: Frozen
des: With time passing and seasons changing... their love still lingers.
cast: Kumiko Konishi, George Ruiz

title: Guillemot
des: Young romance set against a backdrop of peers, pressure and a pitiless adult world.
cast: Jayrue Bartley, Sinead Foran, Micaiah Jackson, Doyin Julius

title: Lost Property
des: When you lose something dear to your heart, there is only one place it can be found. The Lost Property office.
cast: Asa Lucander

title: In the Future Love Will Also
des: If our memories can be seized and our identities erased, would we lose ourselves? In the sometime future, in an unnamed city that is under constant surveillance, a man tries to hold on to what little he has left by obsessively photographing his surroundings, even though making images is forbidden in his world - they control what you try to remember. But in her, he finds something solid and real. The man and woman soon find themselves under investigation. We watch as the young couple's intimate memories, their hopes, longings, and fears are picked through. While they are slowly being erased from their own love story, we find out what remains. In flashes, we capture snippets of the oldest story there is. In The Future Love Will Also happen, save, betray, fulfill, fall apart, be worth dying for, mend, destroy, survive, find a way, exist...
cast: Jenny Heaton, Al Patrick Jo, Doug E. Doug, Lesleh Donaldson

title: Love Always
des: In 1942, a young woman fends off the fears and trials of war by reading the letters her lover sends home. When the letters stop coming, she falls into a secretive affair with the village postman, but his motives are not what they seem.
cast: Louie Allen-Eldridge, Richard Baugh, Tara Dowd, Eliza Jade

title: Whole 'Nother Level
des: A cerebral palsy-stricken young man, living with his elderly, chronically-ill parents, must pass a motor skills test to escape being sent away to live in a home for disabled adults.
cast: Brett Emanuel, Achara Kirk, Alain Azoulay, Skye Barnes

title: The Helmet
des: Desperate to ask their crush to the dance, Owen, and his friend Danny, use a special helmet that allows them to replay Owen's memories with his crush to decipher whether or not his crush likes him.
cast: Tucker Price, Collier Stafford, Priyanka Kedia, Lexi Romano

title: Akecheta
des: A Native American Sioux Indian Akecheta is forced to become chief at the crooked hands of Sheriff Dan Brock when his village is slaughtered. He sets out on a journey to retrieve his one and only love Nahimana who was brutally taken by Sheriff Dan Brock and his right hand man Daroll McKintey. On Akecheta's journey he stumbles upon a man Job who is destituted and left to die and who was betrayed by his best friend Daroll McKintey. Job and Akecheta team up together to settle the score and get back what was rightfully theirs and causing havoc along the way.
cast: Martina Griffin, Veronica Pierce, Lupe Trejo, Andy Andersen

title: Missed Call
des: Avoiding the issue, made easy!
cast: Conor Clarke-McGrath, Bethan Jones

title: Resolutions
des: A grieving widower reconnects with his first love who is struggling with a similar problem of her own.
cast: Samantha Behr, Jason Kyle

title: Archive
des: David and Cecilia are archivists, assigned to rid the world of history's burdens; artwork, books, movies, and music. They follow their orders, until one day in an especially peculiar house, they come across something they've never seen before: a human child.
cast: Veronica Argentieri, Maria Boas, Dominic Boucher, Sam Carts

title: Come Here
des: Jackie is crazy in love with Austin, everything about him is perfect but one thing. She doesn't know what he wants with her and sometimes this drives her crazy. She will do the impossible to look for an answer.
cast: Aswan Harris, Sandra Lena

title: Shoebox Memories
des: Add a Plot
cast: Brendan Sheehan, Sean Weiss, Gemma Keenan, Noel Greene

title: Another Day at the Office
des: Busy office worker deals with her usual distractions - her office crush and the office gossip.
cast: Pamela Martin, Rebecca Thomas, Zelika Chante, Monroe Mann

title: Momemo
des: A woman with Alzheimer encounters a man who claims to be her husband. What ensues is a beautiful moment of connection before the nurse returns.
cast: Donald G. Baker, Michelle Dueck, Marie Gleason, Marie Carriere Gleason

title: Field Guide to November Days
des: An almost wordless study of social isolation, mis-communication and sexual identity, 'Field Guide' follows a recently separated couple, Matt (Joe Haege) and Natalie (Briana Ledford), as they attempt a reconciliation. When the relationship fails a second time, each begin to explore their identities independently; Natalie through socially radical action and Matt through his sexuality.
cast: Joe Haege, Briana Ledford, Jeff Mills, Nick Peterson

title: Medea
des: The classical Greek tragedy under a new light of dark romanticism: After being abandoned by her husband Jason, Medea plans the ultimate revenge.
cast: Forrest Lancaster, Sara Murphy, Yvonne LaBarge Nichols, Rachel Rosenbloom

title: Nightmare Foxy X Nightmare Bonnie
des: Add a Plot
cast: Nightmare Bonnie, Nightmare Foxy

title: Terry & Titania
des: Terry's an office worker. Titania's a fairy. Or insane. Potentially both. But when man and untamed nature collide - who'll come out on top? A Shakespeare classic gets a modern makeover in this surreal romantic comedy.
cast: James Harrison, May Phillips, Napoleon Ryan, Vincent Shiels

title: The Last Gift
des: A young woman deals with the loss of her deceased fiance through her memories of their relationship together.
cast: Michelle Hughes, Matt McHugh, Cullen Moss, Madison Moss

title: A Little Ways Down the Road
des: Aryan, a guy in his mid 20s comes to terms with the fact that the one true love he has been after all his life would come to him in ways least expected. 'A little ways down the road' thematically symbolizes the elements of parting ways & distancing in the context of the past, present and future. It is a recurring theme used in the television series 'How I Met Your Mother' and the film being a tribute to the series circles around that theme.
cast: Radhika Malhotra, Maia Sethna, Avinash Tiwary

title: Dream World
des: Taking Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream as its starting point, Dream World follows 4 young couples, caught in the hothouse atmosphere of a wedding and events estate, who constantly fall in and out of love with each other. Love is the drug.
cast: Litha Booi, Lungelo Dhladhla, Oupa Gabaza, Pope Jerrod

title: Stay Single
des: Womanizer Owen Daniels has finally met his match...his dorky roommate, Kevin.
cast: Lucas Jackson, Andrew Saunders, Madeline Orton, Adrienne Laurén

title: John Hughes Is a Lying Bastard
des: It's graduation night- a time of celebration and new beginnings. But for Judah Weiss, (Kane Ashton) it's the end of four years chalk-full of missed opportunity. His dream girl, Molly White, (Johnna Joy Ashton) is just across town at a grad party hosted by the schools elite party boy, but once again Judah is stuck with his rambunctious friends. Joint him on an introspective romp through his failed relationships, poisonous friend ships, and a life-changing field trip, as he decides what to do with his last night of high school.
cast: Kane Ashton, Matt Skinner, Mario Cervantes, Margot Wisel

title: The Last Session
des: A therapist's personal trauma begins to overflow into his professional life.
cast: Alex Kaplan

title: Virgo
des: In an age of virtual dating and social media, face-to-face communication between friends and lovers is proving difficult. 'Virgo' asks the question: is it possible to break the silence and be honest about what is written in the stars?
cast: Letty Thomas, Elliott Ross, Rose Lucas

title: Last Winter
des: Twain, a would-be pianist, wastes away as a bartender in a second-rate restaurant. He doesn't play in public, is socially withdrawn and reluctant to share his feelings. But when a beautiful new waitress named Layla shows up at the restaurant where he works, Twain must come out of his shell to have any chance to woo her. Meanwhile, he meets a sweet young music teacher named Julie. She falls for him, enchanted by his charms, and becomes his supportive, lovestruck companion. But what happens when the girl of his dreams finally responds to his advances?
cast: Robin Dorsey, Al Ghanekar, David Greenfield, Carla Long

title: Best of Both Worlds
des: Struggling to find a normal woman, Charlie meets Michelle and questions if he can accept the 'Best of Both Worlds' when she reveals she turns into a guy named Michael during the day.
cast: Kevin Anthony Brooks, Heidi Heaslet, Steven Sims, Alex Ruiz

title: Ok Breathe Auralee
des: Take a journey with a baby-crazed young lady.
cast: Nathaniel Arcand, Kendra Mylnechuk, Peter O'Leary

title: On the Runway
des: Marie a New York model from a small company it's in a crossroad. A big company offers her an opportunity that will change her life. Marie has to decide between her career and the love of her life.
cast: Gabriel Barba, Leilani Gacutan, Emilie Germain, Megan Haley

title: I'm Dating the Antichrist
des: Christopher's love life is turned upside down when he finds out that his girlfriend is the Antichrist.
cast: Dan Greenberg, Eden de Sela, Kevin Kelly, Jefrey Wilkerson

title: Love of the Dead
des: Robert loves Marcy. Marcy would love Robert--if she were still alive.
cast: Vanessa Block, Bill Bradley, Jeremi Szaniawski, Joel Vetsch

title: Her Kind
des: Add a Plot
cast: Julien Flavelle, Alex Jaques, Nicky Torchia

title: Romeo and Juliet
des: We have all known the story of Romeo and Juliet, but do you know this one? This Romeo and Juliet film is filled with bad blood martial arts between two families, the Capulet's and the Montague's. This isn't just any ordinary love story.
cast: Audrey Delgado, David Eban, Johnny Flemming, Spencer Gagnon

title: Little Things
des: The inner workings of young relationships.
cast: Theodore Antoniou-Philips, Daisy Bertenshaw, Michael Bertenshaw, Jean-Luc Daurat

title: Two Plans, Two Sisters & a Parade
des: Three years in the making by the community of Bollington, Cheshire, UK, entirely by volunteers, young and old. The story is about Helen and Candy Chapman whose lives have reached a crossroads. Follow the Two Sisters in a feel-good romance as they make life-changing decisions in their quest for happiness. The final scene of the film involved over 500 people.
cast: Kay Boggatt, Claire Fox, Jennifer Hayes, Tim Lane

title: Disasterpiece
des: Meet Jack Docherty: the nicest guy you'll ever meet with two restraining orders. Jack seeks out the help of therapist Neal Hannon to discover why he continues to fall in love with crazy women. Jack reflects on all his romances, past and present, and finds that the person most responsible for his plight may be himself.
cast: Stephen Allison, Steve Allison, Sasha-Almeida Beers, Rachel Delante

title: Love Platter... Serves Two
des: a lovable regular IT guy with simple life aspirations, ends up falling in love with happy-go-lucky girl.
cast: Amit Diondyi, Deepti Dyondi, Sudarshan Patil, Pratibha Tiwari

title: Dinner for Two
des: An eager Pablo prepares a romantic dinner for his dream date, but the evening doesn't quite go as planned.
cast: Liz E. Morgan, Ricardo Dal Moro, Christian Liatos

title: Flying Without Wings: Life with Arnold Beisser
des: Just a months before the polio vaccine became available, tragedy struck Dr. Arnold Beisser. Suddenly the national tennis champion and surgeon found himself in an iron lung, unable to move. Family, friends, colleagues and Arnold himself tell this inspiring journey of loss, acceptance, triumph and love - how he thrived for 40 years becoming an award-winning psychiatrist, professor, writer and trailblazer in sports medicine, Gestalt therapy and community mental health.
cast: LIV Estrup

title: Loves Me Not
des: A young woman blinded by love and jealousy slowly uncovers her lover's dark and secretive life.
cast: Luccia Rivera, Mark Whitten, Chele André, Juan Santos

title: Johnny Be Gone
des: Johnny is what you might call misunderstood. His roommate Logan seems to be the only one that understands him. Then again, the rabbit knows all.
cast: Devlin Wilder, Joe Hammerstone, Katie Deerest, Carrie Lax

title: The Pleasing List
des: Film student with Asperger's Syndrome attempts to overcome his social challenges during dinner with a fellow student.
cast: Kendall Miller, Jessie Owen Cope, Marcus Bradford, Jeremy Lasman

title: Carlos Dunn's Katherine
des: A beautiful woman and her boyfriend are trying to escape from sadistic serial killers.
cast: Tina Grimm, Tempast Wulf, Mel Heflin, Andrew Schaefer

title: Endeavour
des: A young boy goes to great lengths to impress his first love, the new girl next door.
cast: Alan Chow, Lena Torluemke, Ryan McMillan, Adam Bullard

title: Cleaner
des: At a family-run dry cleaner, Jae pursues her desires as her mother struggles to keep the business going in the face of pressure from a crime syndicate. But when Jae decides to put an end to the extortion payments, the secrets of her family past come to the surface. Set within the Korean gangland of Los Angeles, CLEANER is a portrait of desire and the bonds of blood.
cast: Suilma Rodriguez, Kenzo Lee, Susan Park, Alexis Rhee

title: Giselle
des: One month after breaking up with Giselle, Jamie wrestles with romantic memories and surreal house guests.
cast: Chasen Bauer, Garrett Coffey, Chris Fornataro, Megan McIver

title: Liz
des: When ten-year-old Kevin learns that his best friend, Liz, is moving away, he decides to run away with her so that they can be together. However, during the course of the night, Kevin slowly realizes that a life on the run is not what he wants for the girl he cares so much about.
cast: Ryan Grantham, Vanessa Rae Evancic, Britt MacLeod, David Mohr

title: Riding Big: The Movie
des: After ending up in the wrong place at the wrong time, an ex-military drag racer skips town with his love interest. With a bounty on his head, he must use any means necessary to survive.
cast: Tuquan Smith, Wankaego, Doo-Doo Brown, Darron Spencer

title: Nora
des: The onset of a new American depression has a young woman left with little options as a single day takes her for a trip through a romantic and brutal fever dream.
cast: Ty Fanning, Jessica Froelich, Brooklyn Unger, Natalie Lawson

title: Harry Grows Up
des: New York is a tough place to find love. Especially for an 18-month-old living on his own.

title: Promposal
des: Add a Plot
cast: Michelle Rundquist, Spencer Kakacheck, Anna Peterson, Libby Markham

title: Legend
des: A teenager who is not fully fond about her cultural background; her father Carlos who has been absent most of her life is now ill and trying to bond a father-daughter relationship. It is now Carlos last wish to reconnect her to her Mexican roots. Carmen is about to experience her heritage in a different perspective with the help of her father, it's a coming of age film about cultural identity and family values.
cast: Randy Vasquez, Joseph Valdez, Angie Sanchez

title: Two Skeletons
des: Two strangers living in New York. One Halloween they discover that, in a city of 8 million people, you might just bump into the one person looking for.
cast: Haley Andrewsen, Seb Blunt, Sebastian Blunt, Marco de Ornella

title: Bluebird
des: An homage to Charles Bukowski's poem, BLUEBIRD. A film that follows two people, from two opposing worlds - as they navigate the night, looking for their escape...

title: Bald Face Lie
des: At the end of a date, just how honest should a guy be?
cast: Katha Busk, Cordelaine Kline, Ryan Lewellen, Natalie Makenna

title: Julie
des: When the love your life leaves you... who would you turn to? When only a miracle can bring her back. What would you do?
cast: Deepika Anbazhagan, Shreya Gupto, Syama Sundar Joysula, Kiran Naig

title: Clockwise
des: Freud, Erikson, and the quest for love turn a cocky college guy's world upside down.
cast: Ben Whitehair, Aspen Patrice Schleser, Timothy Englert, Christine Mascolo

title: Domestic Disco
des: The sounds of a couple's domesticity powers a rack of disco lights that follows them throughout their house in this experimental, queer, romantic comedy. Domestic Disco (2014) is directed by visual artists Rob Fatal and Jessica Leimone. The film bears the duo's comic/experimental signature which aids in the work's investigation of what being in a queer relationship can look like.
cast: Mark Espinosa, Jiz Lee

title: What's My Name: A Morning After Fail
des: What happens when you wake up next to a beautiful woman and can't remember her name? A kung fu battle. Obviously.
cast: Lauren Compton, Christopher Naoki Lee

title: Okay, Cupid?
des: Add a Plot
cast: Abby Buchman, Helen Kuhar, Julia Marshall, Liliana Miller

title: The Vehicle
des: A man tries to convince a woman that they have a future together.
cast: Garry Chalk, Gillian Barber

title: Dog on Shame
des: They say a dog is a man's best friend. Well, in this outrageous comedy, Brandon 'Snack Bar' Lewis, puts that saying to the test when his dog's calamitous behavior leaves him on the verge of losing everything he holds dear. Dog on Shame features actor, writer and comedian Brandon 'Snack Bar' Lewis as the well meaning, but impulsive husband who suddenly finds himself in trouble with his job, his wife, Ryan, and even his dog, the family Boxer, Sydney. Follow Brandon, Ryan and Sydney through the ups and downs of life as they try to make it all work. Will this awkward three way relationship survive? Find out in Dog on Shame!
cast: Mandrel Drakes, Bryan Hill, Brandon Lewis, Desiree Townsend

title: That One Night
des: After an all night partying, a guy wakes up to texts from a girl who also doesn't remember the night.
cast: Hanna Oldenburg, Eric Budianto Thornton

title: Paj Ntaub - The Rose Cloth
des: A love triangle between two good friends Nraug Hli Xiong aka 'X', Tou Lee and a fictional dream girl, Nkauj Hnub Xiong. X is every woman's dream man. He's successful, intelligent and beyond gorgeous, but even with all his good fortune X is empty knowing and sensing that his life is hollow and missing an essential element. Searching for the spark to his life X turns to his dreams and there finds this fantasy girl. Their love blossoms in his subconscious and X deters from reality to find a way to make his fantasy love come to life. However, trying to change the hands of fate, changes their destiny and X is trapped between two worlds.
cast: Steve Moua, Nancy Vang, Gideon Xiong, Agnes Mayasari

title: The Diary of Trumpington Street
des: 1931. Two Cambridge finalists share a quiet moment before they depart their college. Vishal, a Law finalist from Madras, is due to return home, and Edward, a Philosophy finalist, ponders on his impending marriage.
cast: Alexander Nair, Simon Stallard

title: The Adventures of Fiyah Dog
des: When wanna-be gangster and aspiring Jamaican Dance Hall Singer Francis Gay (Jeremy Garza) moves to St. John in the U.S. Virgin Islands he immediately takes on the image of a West Indian Thug named 'Fiyah Dog'. After accidentally running his car into sexy Ginger (Geri Droessler), he falls deeply in love with her, but is thwarted by a cocky beach hunk Sven Wolff (Dru Moore) who has a seemingly supernatural ability to get women. Along the way Fiyah Dog is surrounded by an unusual cast of colorful characters, preparing to send him on the Greatest Adventure of his life.
cast: Jeremy Garza

title: Milk and Honey
des: On her fifteenth birthday, Maya Rivera makes the ultimate decision to run away from her abusive foster home. She confesses her escape plans to her loyal boyfriend, Josiah, but little does she know her crazed and jealous stepbrother, Johnny, is hot on their trail.
cast: Billy Conahan, Nicholas Do, Maria Huyghue, Joshua Rivera

title: Boy
des: Joey is 15 years old and he is hasn't quite figured the difference between poetry and pornography.
cast: Ashley Atwood, Taylor Carroll, Drew Petriello, Lara Repko

title: I Am They
des: I Am They - A Non Binary Love Story - is a feature length documentary that explores non binary trans issues from the personal perspective of Fox and Owl Fisher, non binary trans activists from the UK. In the film they explore issues and challenges faced by non binary trans people, such as legal recognition, language, health care and social acceptance. Despite the film being educational and exploring social issues, it is also a love story of two people from totally different backgrounds finding each other.
cast: Fox Fisher, Owl

title: Two
des: A short documentary that follows 58 yr old Julian as he spends a weekend in an adult baby nursery to celebrate his 2nd Birthday (for the 40th time).
cast: Maya Newell

title: Niña Del Tango
des: When a gallery painting catches the eye of a little girl, the curator tells her the story of its origin. Set in 1940s Argentina, the legend involves a painter, his muse, and the Tango--a dance that brought them together and threatened to tear them apart.
cast: Mayte Valdes, Carlos Barrionuevo, Harwood Gordon, Jada Facer

title: Porch Stories
des: PORCH STORIES interweaves three different stories on three porches in a changing neighborhood one day in summer. Emma is about to get married when a man from her past shows up on her porch, throwing her planned out life into confusion. Across the street, an elderly Portuguese couple argue about divorce, and a musical brother/sister duo pursue their dreams without worrying about the consequences.
cast: Laura Barrett, Jose Miguel Contreras, Brad Hart, Reid McMaster

title: Gruyeres
des: Two heartbroken strangers meet by chance while traveling through Switzerland. Are there second chances at love? Recognizing in the other a shared sadness and a kindred soul, each begins to reveal past hurts and unhealed wounds. Upon each revealing, hope grows. Is it too late or rather too soon for love?

title: Tender Comrades
des: Tender Comrades plays on the conventions of documentary film making to tell a fictional story of a radical intellectual celebrity named Sophie Vix Maurer and her biggest fan: a fictionalized version of the artist herself. Shot partially at Occupy Wall Street, the film uses real-life events, fake interviews, and lo-fi re-enactments to illuminate a seldom examined history of anarchism and subversive movements. The stories Sophie re-tells are drawn from the memoirs of 20th century anarchists Alexander Berkman and Emma Goldman, the legendary shooting of their contemporary, Voltairine de Cleyre, and a heart-wrenching anecdote about two women imprisoned during the Dirty War in Argentina.

This work is widely performed around the globe, and no wonder - it's about the world's most popular pastime, falling in love. But as Puck knows, falling in love can make fools of us all!

title: Adams Morgan: The Movie
des: Two pivotal days will impact the futures of three couples - one married, one just getting started, and one on the rocks - in this romantic comedy shot on location in Adams Morgan. Weaving together different story lines, ADAMS MORGAN: THE MOVIE brings to life the dynamism of Washington, DC through the various points of view of the men and women who live - and love - in Adams Morgan. Richard (Altorro Black), a hardworking father and husband, is bored. He's lost his mojo at his job, but is realizing it's part of a larger problem. His wife Shelby (Jenlene Nowak), emotionally and physically unfulfilled, wants nothing more than to renew their spark, but neither knows how or where to begin. Lance (Shaz Khan), a charming bartender, and Tonya (Blair Bowers), an ambitious career-girl, are young, beautiful, but full of problems. After nine months of dating, the feeling that they are on two distinct paths might force them to separate once and for all. Audrey (Sarah Taurchini), vulnerable from a recent break-up, meets John (Noah Baron), good-hearted but uncertain, at a Halloween party, where things progress quickly. It seems like a match made in heaven - until Audrey's former flame resurfaces, threatening the two from taking off. ADAMS MORGAN: THE MOVIE takes an insightful, witty and honest look at the issues facing couples at various points in their relationships, against the unique and dynamic backdrop of one of DC's most diverse and vibrant neighborhoods.
cast: Noah Baron, Altorro Prince Black, Blair Bowers, Paul Flippin

title: The Chicken Farmer
des: The Chicken Farmer is a short film about Stan, an introverted high school student growing up in the late 1950's with his best friends, Rita, a chicken farmer, and Brian, an athlete. Stan begins his senior year of high school by anonymously admitting his love for Rita by graffiting the words, "Chicken Farmer I love you" across from her house. As their senior year continues however, Rita and Brian fall in love, sending Stan on a journey of heartache and self-discovery. Stan's future after high school takes him far from Rita and Brian, but their hearts and friendship allows for them to come together again. The story follows Stan, Rita, and Brian throughout their lives, becoming victims of time, and where they learn the importance of friendship and taking action for the right reasons.

'My goal for this film is to shine light into a dark place, this dark place is culture. Culture tells us that satisfying ourselves without worrying about the effects or outcome from our actions is normal, if we get instant satisfaction, it's good. This film is stepping into a dark 'room' to give it light, you have to rid the 'devil in the doorway' from blocking the light.' - Chase Tarca

cast: Héctor González, Tappy, Óscar Ibáñez, Sally Greenland

title: Unfinished Love Story
des: A young woman travels to San Francisco determined to meet her old love. Yet drifting through the city she has to face reality- a state beyond ideals and romance.
cast: Zachary Culbertson, Katharina Rivilis

title: Endless Summer
des: Summer of 2003. Climate Change is reality. Abel is in love.
cast: Boban Kuleski-Czajkowicz, Sarah-Louisa Rohrer

title: Blind Heart
des: Based on Real celebrity Art teacher Conni Gordon, Blind Heart is a story about Veteran Marine who loses his eye sight in war and returns to darkness and despair. He drives his loving wife away. Conni Gordon teaches this Blind Veteran how to paint and makes him see through his paintings.
cast: Sam Brittan, Ramon Camacho, Dawn Davis, David George

title: A Seduction Spell
des: A Seduction Spell features three young people (Bonnie, Ernie and Marnie) who, like many others today, are addicted to their smartphones, even to the extent where they have lost the ability to communicate with each other in any meaningful way. The two main characters are Bonnie, an egocentric young woman accustomed to manipulating the people around her to get what she wants; and Rob, who is somewhat of a social misfit and prefers older technology. Rob is completely infatuated with Bonnie and is thrilled when she pays attention to him, only to become totally crushed when the realization hits that she truly is using him.
cast: Erin Maxwell Albert, Adara Broyles, Danielle Pilon, Shawn Vervoorst

title: One Way Ticket
des: Follows one man's journey on his last day at home before leaving his country to surprise the love of his life.
cast: Reinaldo Marcus Green

title: Self Inflicted
des: Jim's just a regular guy, besides his masochistic tendencies, who's looking for Ms. Right. Can he control his destructive urges long enough to reign her in? Find out in this dark, romantic comedy.
cast: Levi Anderson, Jazmine Dake, Danielle Kelly, Brian LeBlanc

title: The Little Mermaid
des: A mermaid longs to ascend onto land and win the hand of a handsome prince. A contemporary twist on the classic Hans Christian Anderson tale "The Little Mermaid."
cast: Cory Batchler, Marianne Verrone, Liza Woythaler

title: Anonymous
des: Two men connect online and decide to take it to the next level anonymously. sometimes you have to close your eyes to see what's in front of you.
cast: Michelangelo Milano, Gregory Kennedy

title: La Amante
des: 'La Amante' short Fashion/Art Film shot in London by producer Stephen J Bell, working with model/dancer Taryn Andreatta in a collaboration that depicts sensual mesmerizing scenes of a woman baring raw aspects of her soul, caught in a drift between sadness and nostalgia for a once idealized love. Music by Ilya "The Last Castrato"
cast: Taryn Andreatta

title: Subterranean Love
des: Two lonely people, with personal baggage, on separate evenings out - on the same street in Greenwich Village, she with a friend, he alone, end up on the subway platform where an old Eastern European woman plays rueful accordion music (she becomes a muse/cupid). They get into the same subway car and from there surreptitiously observe each other and submerge themselves in romantic fantasies (black and white). They never speak and she, just before exiting the train, has one last 'fantasy kiss' on the train, ending their 'romance.' Haunting accordion music and subway imagery add a fine subtlety to the romance and mystery.
cast: Mark Borkowski, Karen Giordano, Marcia Haufrecht, Suzanne DiDonna

title: Sparks
des: After her plus 1 stands her up at a rehearsal dinner, a neurotic young wedding guest flees the venue in embarrassment, and has a serendipitous run-in with an ex. This impromptu reunion leads to a spontaneous, romantic, adventure through the streets of Los Angeles, and the hope that the passage of time can mend a rift between two people who couldn't figure it out the first time.
cast: Selam Andeberhan, Julian Bah, David Barahana, DeShaude Barner

title: I Arrived
des: A short film based on a true story. This is the immigration story of Polina, a beautiful Russian girl. On the eve of her wedding day she discovers her fiance is cheating on her. She packs her bags, leaving her job, family and friends back in Russia, she moves to NY. She boards a plane of self-discovery but her past keeps following her.
cast: Evgeniya Orudzheva, Alexander Topolsky, Benjamin Jones, Tatyana Zbirovskaya

title: Three Months Time
des: An aspiring mechanic has to choose between love with a small-town girl or a friendship with his needy, stoner best friend. Directed and written by 19 year-old filmmaker, Brady Scott Palubiski. Independently shot in Southeastern Wisconsin with a budget of $150.00.
cast: Taylor Gall, Anthony Mattias, Paul Moroder, Brady Palubiski

title: Allez
des: The film is about a young quiet girl (Sofia), who experiences a strong fascination with the female talent (Trine) in their fencing club, but when Trine gets selected to train in the big club Heidenhein in Germany, Sofia has only one evening to take action and find out what this fascination includes, but she is conflicted between her family and her own will. Sofia finally acknowledges that she must overcome her own limitations and make her own choices and engage in a last attempt to have this fascination clarified.
cast: Luise Skov, Anna Stokholm, Dan Zahle, Ann Hjort

title: Mustachio
des: Mustachio must tame his namesake mustache if he's to win the heart of beautiful pen pal Claudette.
cast: Chris Demarais, Josh Flanagan, Stephen Gamache, Adam Garrett

title: Kasumi
des: Kasumi, a Japanese woman comes to New York to follow the memories and dream of her late fiance, Togo, who wanted to be a photographer. There she eventually finds her way of life.
cast: Peter Gingerich, Tsukasa Kondo, Rieko Masaki, Christopher Sanchez

title: Bodhi
des: A lonely man has an enlightening first-ever experience.
cast: Tom Crowhurst, Jenna Fincken, Megan Pemberton

title: My Date with Adam
des: A wedding planner uses internet dating to find the perfect man, and finds him--only to discover he's actually a robot.
cast: Tressa Glover, Brian Morvant, Julianne Avolio, Dennis Schebetta

title: A Little Distracted
des: Oscar is dating Sarah. He's best friends with Sarah's twin sister, Alex. Sarah isn't happy.
cast: William Mark McCullough, Andrea Savo, Tyler Tongate

title: In Their Own Way
des: When two lovers on the fringes test each other's will, what remains of the past weighs against the thread that holds their future.
cast: Carolyn Myers Kashner, Chris Brady

title: Winky Face
des: Simon knows every girl is just waiting to find that guy who will ride in on a white horse and sweep them off their feet. If only he could tell which girls wanted to just be friends. Winky Face is romantic comedy about love and miscommunication.
cast: Brea Bee, Nick Echols, Robert Gibbons, Aaya Lawhorn

title: Dessert and Suicide
des: A dark comedy about blind dates.
cast: Mike D. Bowers, Aggie Cozine, Ashley Cozine, Joe Cozine

title: Where the Sun Kisses the Ocean
des: Stunning sky beautiful ocean stirring music and poetry weave together to take you on a journey that will leave you uplifted and open your hart.
cast: Donna DeLory, Michael Karlin, Finian Makepeace, Josie Maran

title: Giselle
des: Inspired by the original ballet, Giselle tells the story of beautiful, young Syrian refugee who falls in love with a charming but manipulative and career driven politician and businessman.
cast: Gundula Schulze, Camila Schäefer Rodrigues, Judith Waldhorn, Victor Wisehart

title: Intuition
des: In her sleep, Janet Scott has been having recurring visions of a murder. She swears she remembers witnessing it, but there's no evidence other than her own muddled dreams. Her psychiatrist, Dr. Avery, advises her to take a trip. While traveling, She meets the mysterious Tony Gable. The two strike up a friendship and he comforts her. He is always there to calm her after she awakes from one of her visions, which become more vivid each time. Will Janet ever be free from these dreams that plague her?
cast: Todd Jenkins, Bob Olsen, Kimberly Smay, Stacey Weaver

title: Night Stream
des: A young Internet radio show host unskilled at practicing what he preaches gets involved with a female caller caught in an abusive relationship.
cast: André Joseph, Aesha Waks, Reginald L. Barnes, Erin Marie Adams

title: Deep Storage
des: Two loners find love in the most unromantic of places.
cast: Miles O'Neil, Alice Ansara, James Lawson, Dawn Klingberg

title: Style My Love
des: Shontelle Aguilera loves two things in life, young attractive men and shopping. After Shontelle finally stumbles into the position of Assistant Manager at the prestigious 'Chanel', she swiftly begins to fall in love with her boss, Avan. After a disturbed first date, Shontelle's discoveries change her perspective of her dream career and the way she treats others.
cast: Natalie Tesoriero, Jack Taylor, Chanel Mestousis, Arash Atah

title: Infinity & Chashu Ramen
des: Two spirits link the lives of dozens of residents of San Francisco's Japantown as told through a series of six interwoven vignettes.
cast: Sandra Young, Jean Franco, Anna Jones, Khoi Tran

title: The Infirmary
des: Adam attempts to transport inside his wife's coma before they pull the plug.
cast: Robert Brettenaugh, Brittany Molnar, Robert Partridge, Jack Vecchio

title: 2nd Chance at Christmas
des: Sal is kidnapped by his best friend to return home for the holidays, with his family and his ex-fiancee Michelle.
cast: Salvatore Tramontana, Ellana Morris, Johnathan Chei, Kerry Connors

title: Just Another Tuesday
des: Ben and Clark don't know each other, but they affect each others lives in ways they can't imagine.
cast: Grant Alsup, Thomas Boyle, Paul Davidson, Luke Glassman

title: Prom Night
des: 'Prom Night' is a dark romantic comedy about Max, a high school senior, who is navigating his own insecurities and the advances of Sylvie, his more sexually experienced girlfriend. As prom night approaches and the pressure mounts, everyone from his best friend to his parents offer advice on his love life, and Max must step up and face his fears. After all, what's the worst that could happen?
cast: Emily Ackerman, Ali Axelrad, Stefanie Brown, Catherine Curtin

title: Bu ai bu san
des: Three stories: An assistant marriage officiator in love with her engaged boss. A psychosomatically colour-blind pool champion cannot get over the death of her boyfriend. A tour guide in love with a woman seeking the legendary white lotus.
cast: Lik-Sun Fong, Jiong He, Wah Hong, Timmy Hung

title: An Old Spark
des: A bitterly divorced elderly woman finds herself moving into a care home only to discover her ex-husband is her neighbour. Their hatred for each other soon brings out the quirky personality traits that once upon a time brought them together.
cast: Peter Ellis, Sandra Voe, Victoria Lucie

title: Status
des: 2018. The world is changing. Social networking sprawls far beyond beyond desktop computers and iphones. "Welcome to Statlink." Live connected 24/7 though microchips inserted directly into your scull and veins. Ultimate connection is yours. It is only a thought away. New years eve sees Statlink change. The voices in your head are beginning to blur. Are they your thoughts? Are they mine? The system is failing. Or is it your desire that it should evolve? A cloudy hunger within you grows stronger and stronger. We march as one towards a single identity. Duality emerges. Users stand glowing in the sun while the old world screams caution from the dark. Jason beholds a world in flux and sees his girlfriend leaving our shores. He fights to save her as the streets erupt into chaos and fire. Welcome to a new world. Welcome to connection as you have never known. Welcome to the evolution of social networking.
cast: James Ballard, Cat Commander, Ellen Grimshaw, Kathryn Tohill

title: Ave Maria
des: Add a Plot
cast: Wendell Charles NeSmith

title: Sugar Plumb Daniels
des: Nina Daniels is an up and coming junior account executive at a boutique public relations marketing firm. Her boss wants her to shape up, ship out or possibly reconsider the nauseating concept of marital bliss.
cast: Anissa Smith, Tanya Thompson, Lance Liverpool, Don Forcer

title: Limbo
des: A love story of a man and woman who are meant for each other, but cannot have each other. One heart, two worlds, one barrier.
cast: Jovan Pierre, Jendayi Cesar

title: The Ocean & You
des: Our marine treasures are disappearing. Our cookbooks could end up in museums. Do we care if our grandchildren get the chance to swim with dolphins or whales, or on living reefs filled with colorful fish? The Ocean & You is about love, interconnectedness and personal responsibility. With a gently compelling narrative largely uncoupled from the visual story, this lyrical film encourages viewers to craft their own meanings from facts and information: to synthesize what they know with who they are, and, hopefully, with what might be. There is really only one ocean, and we are all of us connected to it with every breath we take, and by everything else we do and make. This short film by Spartacus Shapiro embodies his efforts for challenge, choice & promise.
cast: Spartacus Shapiro

title: Mount Hopeless
des: Mount Hopeless is a comedy about isolation, creature comforts, and escaping this rut we call Life.
cast: Shanna Berry, Kaemie McCanless, Naythan Smith, Key Tawn Toothman

title: Blood on Canvas
des: Unlicensed boxing in the 70's was a thriving but brutal sport in London, England. The likes of Lenny McLean, Pretty Boy Shaw and Mad Dog Mullins are famous for seeking the ultimate accolade of 'The Guv'nor'. We follow the son of a man like one of these brutal, fighting machines and how the loss of his father, his incapable and neglecting mother and a gang on the estate terrorise him to find the inevitable fighting anger thriving through his blood.
cast: William Scully, Max Scully, Georgie Grier, Justin Cavell

title: Xoxosms
des: Add a Plot
cast: Nancy Schwartzman

title: Until We Meet Again
des: "Until We Meet Again" is the story of Lucy Daniel, a loving and compassionate woman who must fight in her last moments with stage four cancer as she recalls joyous memories with her husband.
cast: Maurice Chevalier, Ali Froid, Bella Lotz

title: Into Trance
des: The struggle of a socially awkward Joe, finding himself stuck between his dreamworld and a party.
cast: Chelsea Brown, Viktor Jonsson, Gabriela Midori, Aatef Nazar

title: Glasslands
des: In the midst of a quarter life crisis a young woman gives up everything she worked for in her 20s to chase a dream, and explores friendship and sexuality along the way.
cast: Tasha Petty

title: Indoorsman
des: Add a Plot
cast: Todd Lien, Raisa-Dielle Riikonen, Samantha Rose Baldwin, Lee Chen

title: 7:33 am
des: Two women are unknowingly dating the same man. The real drama unfolds when the two women find out about one another despite the carefully-orchestrated mechanisms of their boyfriend. The journey is told from three different points of view.
cast: Candice Myers, Reina Poindexter, Cedric Stewart

title: Letter to Bijou
des: A musical-visual dialog, a story driven by lost love between youth and adulthood. The trail of becoming full at the expense of a family's love. The trouble to make the son improve on the father at the expense of both.
cast: Isa McMurry, Liana Tarte, Laya Shabazz, Elijah Starr

title: Goin' Guerrilla
des: All Jeff wanted to do was make his own movie. He didn't realize he just declared war on the whole industry. Now he must take his script, his rag-tag group of filmmakers, and all the gear they can scrounge up and go guerrilla.
cast: Mark McCarver, Stephanie Dunbar, Benjamin Jabe, Ashley Serrao

title: Politico
des: On the eve of a major political primary, a young Democratic campaign strategist has a chance encounter with an old flame - who also happens to be a major conservative columnist.
cast: Alexander Bedria, Jessica Barth, Jose Molina

title: The Great Indian Marriage Bazaar
des: In the middle of a family wedding, documentary filmmaker, Ruchika is put on the spot as her aunts poke at her about 'mission son-in-law'. As the pressure mounts, Ruchika narrates her story of going through with the arranged marriage process in modern-day India in this quirky and profoundly raw film. Since India is the home to 40 percent of the world's marriages, of which 90 percent of these are arranged, 'The Great Indian Marriage Bazaar' is a film told through the Directors' lens about issues of morality, sexuality, beauty and femininity and most identity of cosmopolitan Indian women today.
cast: Ruchika Muchhala, Faiza Ahmad Khan

title: Salt & Pepper
des: Add a Plot
cast: Angie Chace, Edson Chace, Liam Hughes, Lauren McGee

title: The Bridges
des: For the last seven years, John has tried and succeeded to provide everything his wife Lisa has ever wanted, with the exception of one thing... a child. Lisa's love for John has begun to fade, and in its place the lust for another man has taken over. Filled with drama, danger and treachery, the plot leads Lisa to take the most important decision of her life, only to come to find out that she is not the only one with a secret.
cast: Mira Layne, Alain Saadeh, David Stanford

title: Endearingly Mad
des: Twenty-something Jayne lives a happy life as an advertising executive with her boyfriend Tom, a bicycle shop owner, who's eager to settle down. That is until the recession strikes and Jayne's job in the capital falls victim to the double dip; leaving her unemployed and underwhelmed in London. When Tom jokes with Jayne about joining a support group for those jilted by the recession, she ends up meeting Jess; the groups free spirited leader and activist. Together they attend anti-capitalist protests where Jayne finds a new occupation but loses sight of her home; neglecting her relationship with man who's planning the perfect proposal.
cast: Caroline Bartholdson, Jay Hanson, Alexandra Metaxa

title: Worlds on Fire
des: WORLDS ON FIRE Can orthodox religious people survive and live together without killing each other if their children marry? Susan is Jewish, age 22 and comes from NYC. Amman is Muslim, age 23 and comes from Damascus, Syria. Susan and Amman are students who meet at University in NYC. They fall in love and are on a collision course to marry. Exciting confrontations, battles, and clashes erupt. Their parents are against the marriage and refuse to come to the wedding. Lots of trouble, conflict, and obstacles are in their path. Will they survive and live together without killing each other?
cast: Theodore Bouloukos, Michael B. Chadwick, Mollie Collison, Lauren Frances

title: Last of Our Kind
des: Weaving together film, music and poetry, "Last of Our Kind" transforms the memory of a lost love into a ritualistic incantation of longing. Action is exaggerated and time seems to blur, as the lovers' tale unfolds poetically into a modern interpretation of the Persephone myth. Shot entirely on Super-8 - the movie traces the poem, line by line, throughout the city of Seattle in sequences of time-lapse photography blended with live-action that collapse and rearrange time and events into memories. Shot as a silent film, "Last of Our Kind" features an original soundtrack created by Robin Guthrie interwoven with a voiceover recitation of Rick Linville's poem.
cast: Emma Jones, Scott Plusquellec, William Kumma, Mark Harlow

title: Valentina
des: Add a Plot
cast: Javier Boadella, Empar Brisa, Abraham Cisse, Álex Gadea

title: Come Here Often?
des: An off-beat short comedy film about a young man's endearing attempts to gain the attention of a beautiful girl in the most awkward of settings, an STD clinic.
cast: Andres Monsalve, Emma Barrett, Grace Hakimi, Kelsey Lynn Stokes

title: Grace
des: A Catholic teen explores the true meaning of commitment.
cast: Natalie Sharp, Troy Zarubin

title: Greater Love
des: It is the night before the eve of a high-risk uprising by the revolutionaries lead by Arc. Lyn, Arch's subordinate, takes one last chance to go home and say goodbye to his beloved wife. He has transformed his love for his wife into the greater love for his country, and he is ready to die for the cause. His goodbye letter is the last, and most truthful entity/legacy he can leave after for his wife.
cast: Adam Boren Bennett, Helena Escuin, Teli Share

title: Hello, Love, Goodbye
des: Add a Plot
cast: Petya Boycheva, Lyuben Chatalov, Emil Dimitrov, Lorina Kamburova

title: Snitch: All Money Ain't Good Money
des: Jessica is a young lady who wants to become a world renowned journalist. Will, a young man, also has dreams of making it big, dreams he'll conquer by any means necessary. When Jessica is assigned to cover a break-in at a local church, she gets a bigger story than she bargained for when she finds outs her on and off again boyfriend Will may be involved. 'SNITCH' is a story about the choices we make, whether it be out of greed, anger or love.
cast: Keith Anderson, Harris Cox Jr., Natalie Monroy, Sir'Vante Rhodes

title: A Verdant View
des: Add a Plot
cast: Alan Holasek, Kenton Holden, Andrea Hopkins, Sam Keran

title: An Unexpected Valentine
des: Add a Plot
cast: Geoff Barron, Gina D. Brewer, Joy Brewer, Florencio Chavez

title: Pete & Aaron
des: Pete is staying at a hotel. Every month, he is here away from home, his girlfriend and family. But the night away is all he needs to help try and discard the internal conflicts within that scare him, which he tries to remedy by secretly meeting up with random guys off the internet for one night stands. Into this world of angst and confusion comes the latest one night stand in the form of Aaron, and what starts as a usual hook up for both of them eventually becomes something neither of them expected and which will impact on the way they both view life from this night on.
cast: Tony Gibbons, Conner Mckenzy

title: Deighties
des: A tender look at dating in the golden years of your life - your eighties. Phil, a widower at the age of 86, decides to venture into the unfamiliar world of online dating in a search for companionship.
cast: Mason Fleming

title: Marmara
des: Three people unexpectedly unite in an island off the coast of Istanbul. They separately deal with death and abortion while living in their new home. Although they are unable to connect, they slowly discover their surroundings and come to terms with their past. Sudden encounters help heal their loneliness and all find peace within themselves as they let the vastness of the Marmara sea bring them closer.
cast: Amandine Bressand, Charlotte Prager, Baris Yalçin, Berke Üzrek

title: Garden of Carnivorous Plants
des: A young man hikes into the wilderness of Joshua Tree National Park, navigates a labyrinth of sensually carved stone and jagged desert flora, and emerges in a remote valley. He makes camp and begins photographing the exquisite and surreal landscape, until glimpsing a woman camped nearby. The man gradually succumbs to the woman's brazen sexuality, shedding his worldly anxieties and inhibitions, and unearthing desires that both terrify and transform him. Their erotic and richly metaphorical dance, choreographed in long takes with minimal dialogue, culminates in a startling climax. Using an innovative cinematic language, this film strives to restore the sacred aspect to sexuality, remind us of the forgotten power of femininity, and gaze deeply into the primal beauty of nature.
cast: Andreas Blair, Diana Oliphant

title: How to Act Straight
des: A young man tries to 'man up' to win the heart of his best friend on New Year's Eve.
cast: Lex Kilgour, Johnathan Brugal, Megan Hughes, Aidan Sank

title: The Broken Legacy
des: While voluntarily testing a new drug at a research facility, a lost screenwriter recruits the help of an egotistical philosopher in order to attract the girl of his dreams.
cast: Barbara Bell, Joseph Bell, Rayne Bidder, Cynthia Bravo

title: Twin Flame
des: Told through the scope of an Uber driver in San Francisco, Twin Flame highlights an intimate night between two strangers who come together unexpectedly.
cast: William Armando, Diana Gettinger, Rob Healy, Arianna Papalexopoulos

title: Agape Love
des: Dysfunctional relationships, we've all seen them. Maybe you've even had the misfortune of being apart of one. Well, one thing's for certain, it's not something either party thoroughly enjoys, but there's that strange bond that neglects that fact and keeps the ball rolling. Well, how does one break out of that awkward bond you may ask? Well look no further,with a splash of satire, Agape Love has the answer. Sit tight for this vintage, romantic comedy thriller, that is, Agape Love.
cast: Jeremy Marr Williams, Amira Hamid, Sydney Henderson

title: Parallax
des: Two lovers confess their feelings for each other.
cast: DeRon Horton, Ivy Lindsey

title: Zurich 8001
des: When you are alone in a strange city, your friends become your family. This sitcom is about five friends learning about the real world in their dreamland Zurich.
cast: Fabrizio Daniele, Ankita Makwana, Lionel Podarski, Soraja Trigo

title: Find Yourself
des: John, a cellphone technician, has always been interested in the theory of time travel. He receives a phone call from himself 30 years in the future. John must stop the murder of a women he's about to meet in a coffee shop, she's the love of his life.
cast: Mathilde Dratwa, Matthew L. Imparato, Chiz Schultz, Mario Costa

title: Moments
des: A young man always seems to just miss out on those special moments in life, but a chance encounter is about to change that forever.
cast: Simon Hardwick, Lauren Harvey, Grace Laiker, Luke Stanton
