des: Add a Plot
cast: Arianna Gonzales, Max Stevenson, Kuba Chyla, Beau Rutherford
director: Jessica Carmichael, Bert Choe, Chris Cricca, Norman Ford, Shaun Ford, Melody Holden, Taylor Jones, Kassandra Kanaar, Sean Kirby, Ryan Palmer, Christina Regan, Paolo Reyes, Wade Varble

title: SO CLOSE
des: Add a Plot
cast: Penelope Costopoulos, Pedro Guerrero

title: Surface Deep
des: Malcolm and Eva have done something horrible. They try to bury their problems deep in the Irish woods. However tension rises as fate and circumstance continually brings the wayward couple back to the site of their wrong doing. With the pressure escalating will Malcolm and Eva find their way out? Or will the constant reminder of their actions prove to be their downfall?
cast: Rob Bannon, Natalia Kostrzewa

title: Match Made
des: CAN you find love after 70? A romantic 'player, recently widowed, decides to risk it all and look for love one more time. Though, he has some hurdles to face, a sordid episode in his past, an unwilling participant, 'I don't date' 'You don't date? You run a matchmaking service and you don't date?' Will he be successful or will fear stop any chances at happiness and love in two people's lives that really deserve it? Three time Emmy Award winning actress BARBARA BAIN (Mission Impossible, Space 1999) and ROBERT MIANO (Sunny Red in Donnie Brasco) star in this wonderful drama/comedy. Their chemistry is both charming and palpable.
cast: Barbara Bain, Robert Miano

title: Ruprecht
des: The City of Los Angeles is not enforcing the law. Illegal leaf blowers have taken over. One man stands up for justice & finds romance in an unexpected way.
cast: Gerold Wunstel, Terumi Shimazu, Lexy Stork, Jessica Boss

title: What Makes Jada Click?
des: How does an intelligent, successful woman find a love match in the age of Internet technology?
cast: Ashford Applewhite, Danny Boushebel, DeRon Brigdon, Chris Ferretti

title: Violation
des: How do you survive when one violent act blows your world apart? Violation follows a young couple, Reuben and Emma, and how they survive after Emma is raped. It explores the less publicised effects of violent crime such as Post Traumatic Stress, psychological damage, emotional disorder, and relationship breakdown.
cast: Lauren Cooney, Dominic Morgan, Mark Phillimore, Marcus Roberts

title: Distant Places
des: The perspectives of two strangers, an uninspired musician and a conflicted young woman, are changed forever when they meet at a crossroads in their lives.
cast: Ryan Carlberg, Charles Carroll, Jocelin Donahue, Charles M. Howell IV

title: Shining Star
des: Shining Star is an ensemble piece that centers on Alex Cash, a gifted athlete who is bisexual and is diagnosed with HIV after being selected to play professional basketball overseas. He keeps this secret from everyone he loves. He meets a young actress-singer who falls in love with him and is the last one to find out about his secret and sexual orientation. Writer/Director Cassandra Riddick makes her feature-length debut in a film about friendship, love and forgiveness. It's an intimate look into the life of this young man who life is changed forever when he test positive for HIV.
cast: Marty Martin

title: Dirty Laundry
des: Two undercover cops in the red light district slide into a conflict.
cast: Arndt Schwering-Sohnrey, Tobias Licht, Thomas Bartholomäus, Vlasto Peyitch

title: Letting Go
des: Emma Abbott's daily existence is completely wrapped up in the lives of her husband and her two children. Just as she is trying to cope with her youngest child leaving for college, her husband of twenty four years suddenly dies. For the first time in her life, Emma is alone and must now face turning her present existence of solitude and fear into a new beginning. A woman of strong faith, Emma is tested to the core of her being and finds herself angry with God and lost in her new world. God orchestrates divine appointments that bring together an old friend and a new acquaintance to show her how to let go and to live again.
cast: Lisa Arnold, Marcelle Baer, Ross Britz, Ladson Deyne

title: To Almería
des: Life is a journey not a destination, and some journeys matter more than others.
cast: Tábata Cerezo, Stephen Gallacher

title: A Day at the Mall
des: My film is about expanding your horizons and welcoming in new ways of life. Our protagonist is Randall Galloway, a very organized, timely, and timid boy from the suburbs. One day, Randall goes to the mall to get a gift for his grandmother. Once there, he meets a girl named Noelle. Noelle is the complete opposite of him: outgoing, spontaneous, and quirky. Together they go places and do things that Randall would never have even considered before meeting Noelle. They develop a relationship throughout the movie, and in the process Randall uncovers a few secrets about Noelle. By the end, they have both helped each other and Randall has gained a new perspective.
cast: Ben Draffin, Gagik Ghazaryan, Shannon Miglarese

title: Firsts
des: Add a Plot
cast: Victoria Protsenko, Ale Sorina, Valérie Janin-Thyvot, Raquel Maarin

title: In Season
des: Two siblings turn to each other after loss as no one would expect.
cast: Michelle Star, Caterina Campagna, Kelly Ann Walsh, Ella Steinbeck

title: Blind Date Rules
des: An exasperated single gal decides to lay down some ground rules before going on another scary blind date.
cast: Cris Skelton, Brie Eley, Jordan Ogletree, Angela Bennett

title: Beautiful Monster
des: A mild-mannered monster goes out on a beautiful, sunny day looking for love. Rebuffed with extreme prejudice by the first girl he encounters, he wanders aimlessly until he finds redemption in an unlikely place.
cast: Nicolas Barbeau, Richard Barlow, Jocelyn Dotta, Cora Eckert

title: Just Another Day
des: A boring job. A boss half his age. Mind-numbing routine with no one to talk to. People asking 'how are you doing?' without even waiting around for an answer. No attention from anyone. He almost doesn't exist. Will all that change on his Birthday? He has a plan.
cast: Kealani Ashton

title: Licking Lemons
des: A befuddled, late twenty-something woman attempts to navigate the world of post break-up life, in the age of digital nonsense.
cast: Jared Benjamin, Gigi Bermingham, Ryan Caldwell, Monica Herman

title: The Places I Can Never Go Back To
des: We all have places we avoid because they trigger a bad memory. Parks. Cafes. Street corners. Even the most mundane locations can feel tainted once something bad happens there. A restaurant becomes the restaurant where you got that upsetting phone call. A parking lot becomes the parking lot where you and your boyfriend called it quits. This film explores the rise and fall of a relationship through the exact places where things went wrong.
cast: Craig Love

title: Confab
des: Inspired by the classics from Cheers to Friends, Confab is a throwback web series to the golden age of sitcoms: bringing this old school genre to the new medium of the web. Following four college juniors in Washington, D.C. through the most incredible semester of their lives, Confab is an accessible situation comedy with relatable characters, over the top situations and hilarious insight on life, love and pop culture. Everyman Milo, armchair philosopher Floze, coffee shop hipster Deb and reluctant sorority sister Sandy meet every day in the same place on campus. Their lives intersect in this small section of the Union where they confabulate over the novelties of the day. Throughout the series they find themselves wrapped up with the campus freegan, a rogue RA with nothing to lose, the college LARP club, a World War 2 enthusiast sorority sister, their doggelgangers, the tyranny of a fast food chain and much more. A fun and energetic show, Confab delivers on big laughs with characters that mirrors each wacky person you have encountered in your life. bringing fresh and different elements to a format we all love. Follow the adventures, misadventures, excitement, schemes, philosophies, quirks, rivalries, and loyalties of an eclectic group of college friends as they try to make it through another school year amidst odd classes, situations, and even odder people.
cast: Joshua Dick, Caroline O'Grady, Laura Muschelli, Christian M.A. Campbell

title: Run Away
des: When two girls set eyes on each other for first time at a crowded party the moment is frozen, a glass has been spilled and droplets of water hang ominously above both of them, threatening to break their intimate moment. Recklessly abandoning their inhibitions and running away to a subconscious world where they take us on a journey of hope, fear and defeat, the obstacles of the ever impending reality will be the unstoppable reminder that their moment of wildness is fragile and temporary. Run Away is a visual interpretation of the instant when two people connect, the moment before a relationship is identified, and the knowledge that this relationship that will one day become important, but for now, it can only be imagined.
cast: Melissa Baksh, Stephanie Cassidy, Nicola Chance, Alana Gibb

title: Phir Se
des: Karan is driving through the deserted Mauritius countryside. His destination? Unknown. He picks up a mysterious and beautiful hitch-hiker, Ayesha, to join him on his journey. They hit it off immediately - chemistry fizzles within the car and they quickly forget that they are strangers, enjoying the time they spend together. After a terrifying near-death experience, they are forced to spend the night on the side of the road, inside Karan's broken down car. In the morning, Ayesha is gone. Will Karan summon up the courage to pursue true love and find where Ayesha has disappeared to? Can he decipher the clues to discover her mysterious past? And why is it that everything that is happening feels like a severe case of déjà-vu?

But that behind him, the relationship is flourishing, he's been promoted, and Nadia's store is successful. When Walter's niece, Serena (Ashley P. Jones) relocates to Atlanta she meets and falls for, of all people, Tank (Yemar White), her uncles womanizing, egotistical, self-centered, best friend. Knowing that Walter would never consent to, everyone decides to keep the romance a secret. There are two things Ethan cares about Karate and Emma a girl in his neighborhood. He desperately wants to talk to Emma but he is too shy. One day at Ethan's Karate Dojo his Sensei announces a big tournament is coming up. Ethan wants to compete but his Sensei has reservations. Ethan not willing to give up poses a challenge, if he can beat a fellow student in a fight then can he compete. The sensei agrees. As Ethan trains and practices his inner strength and confidence grows. As fight day arrives will his new found confidence and strength pay off. Will Ethan stun and shock everyone with an upset underdog win or will he fall? If he is unable to win will this crush him or will he find another way to rise up and shine?

Two sisters under take to film various stages of hope and laughter setting off on a dream to perform and the challenges of doors being shut around them and hotel rooms being open to them in a quest to have fun and act knowledge the achievements large and small of Mem Shannon, Bobby Rush, Marlee Walker, Kate Brown, Linda and Heather 's road trip.

title: Cristian
des: Cristian (55 years old) sees a girl (20 years old) in a park, crying. He is going through a nostalgic moment. He recalls one of his failed rendezvous from when he was young and decides to tell the story to the stranger in the park, convinced she is sad due to a similar reason. His story is short: in his youth he met a girl and asked her out on a date, but she never showed up. He is still obsessed with her image. He is certain it was love at first sight, although he didn't even know her name. Cristian introduces himself and the sound of his name spoken out loud in the quiet park triggers the revival of those past moments. Cristian relives the failed date. The girl he was waiting for was involved in a car accident and died calling out his name, not too far from the place where they were supposed to meet. This cry for him between life and death haunts him for the rest of his life and finally leads him to the truth.
cast: Dragos Panait, Constantin Florescu, Gabriela Soltuz, Teodora Toader

title: 5 Minutes in Spain

title: Heart Aspirations

The problem is that he is a French guy living in Paris, the City of Love, without a pulse and therefore thinks he cannot love anymore. Meanwhile, Quincy's mother, a black socialite named Mimi Hampton, absolutely abhors the idea that Roger is trying to make Quincy follow in his "White footsteps". Upset that Quincy won't reject his father's offer, Mimi tries to force Quincy to choose sides in their embittered divorce. To escape the constant tug of war, Quincy finds solidarity and acceptance among his friends, and in doing so eventually runs into a woman who makes him question everything he has ever believed. des: The Right Regrets depicts a bittersweet and poignant long distance romance between twice-divorced American woman, Lily McHenry and charismatic and never-before-married Englishman, Charles Wickham. But suspicions soon arise when during a visit to Lily's home in Monterey, California, Charles never talks of Lily visiting him in Vancouver. Whenever she hints he changes the subject. And therein lies the rub; if he's not married, not gay or bi then what is he? Who is he? Ill, perhaps. Or dying, even. Maybe a hoarder. Or just another lying jerk. Gripped by love and aching curiosity, Lily and her friend, Vera, devise a plan that sends Lily on a life-changing adventure. Lily makes a self-discovery as she courageously uncovers Charles's secret.

title: For the Love of Rose
des: Two college guys, Jeff and Frank, drive along an old road discussing Frank's most recent breakup when they suddenly realize they're lost. Luckily, they come upon, Rose, a beautiful but mysterious young woman with a tragic and romantic secret past, walking all alone on the old road. They stop to ask directions and, as it turns out, she is heading to town, to see a movie. Frank is taken in by her innocence and charm so they offer a lift to town. After a few moments of discussion, she gladly accepts the ride. The group arrives at the theater and Frank asks Rose if they might join her for the movie. Rose smiles and graciously accepts the offer. During the movie a few scary parts startle Rose and she grabs hold of Frank's arm. After a while, she relaxes enough that Frank puts his arm around her and she snuggles up to him. During the movie Frank falls strangely and hopelessly in love with Rose. As the trio leaves the theater Jeff and Frank offer her a ride home which she readily accepts this time. The next morning Frank realizes that he left his jacket with Rose so they drive to her home to retrieve it. They arrive at Rose's house and knock on the door. An older woman, Vera, answers the door. After a brief discussion about Rose, Jeff is shocked to learn the truth and the lengths that Frank will go to for the love of Rose.

title: In the Shadows

The film is set to the music of Sergei Rachmaninoff and explores themes of passion, sacrifice, friendship, betrayal, greed, and murder.

Will Joe face his fears and get his Hollywood ending?

title: Unconditional
des: This project was created through the mergence of all four artistic programs (THTR, MUSC, DNCE, FILM) at CU Boulder, by driven and passionate students. Lead by Producer and Directer Jesse Wardak (U.S. Combat Veteran, CU Undergrad 2018), our team managed a cast and crew of 60+ CU students, faculty and alumni. We also worked with over five major companies such as, BMW Gebhardt, Fate Brewing, Dr. Robert Wester, etc.. to produce this project for less than 500$. This film is a physical representation of what diversity and networking can accomplish in a small artistic town like Boulder, Colorado, by students with a mission to not create 'student films,' but instead create 'professional films'.. by students.

What she doesn't know is that the famous Mexican Revolutionary from 1910 had the same name, and that every Mexican knows the national hero. On her search, she meets a young man called Memo, who offers to help her. Torn between attraction and skepticism, she follows him into the mountains.

title: Ex-tasy
des: Ex=tasy is a hilarious, tragic, and often times cynical look at young adults attempting to assimilate into adult society. Connor is a 20 something slacker that dreams of being a musical producer but after his break up with the beautiful and manipulative Liz, Connor shuts down and gives up on his dream. All appears to be lost when Connor receives a chance for redemption when Liz contacts him asking that he attend her going away party before she moves to New York.

des: A young man (He) goes to rooftop every day afternoon, to watch a girl who usually dances there. What He does not know is that the girl actually saw him before on rooftop while he was falling asleep. This afternoon, while He is learning to smoke on rooftop, the girl suddenly appears.

title: Before We Go
des: One August afternoon, two college graduates - Amanda and David - cross paths outside their old elementary school. Amanda is paying one last visit before leaving for graduate school, and David works as a groundskeeper. After getting acquainted, David invites Amanda inside the school, where the two explore the place of their childhood. From the hallways to the classrooms, gymnasium to the library, David and Amanda reminisce about personal memories, and if they ever met as kids - and if not, they wonder how things would have turned out if they had. By the end, Amanda reveals she has to leave, but David is nostalgic and glued to his hometown. The two part ways in a bittersweet fashion, making their relationship a brief but memorable experience.
cast: Eric Boso, Teri Clark, Mitchell Hunt, Christina Lambert

title: Come Here Often?
des: Remember a time before Tinder hookups, text message breakups, and flirtatious Snapchats? Come Here Often? is a trio of stories about analog romance - love stories occurring outside the digital age. Three scenes unfold in the same bar at the same time, exploring the themes of old-fashioned romance.

title: Annie
des: Caught between the undying love of her boyfriend Andy and the wild obsession of a crazed theater producer, Annie cannot remember the traumatic event that lead to her life as a gender-neutral performance artist living in New York. As vague memories from her past begin to resurface, Annie succumbs to the mental pressures of not knowing who she is. After a strange yet enlightening encounter with the sophisticated socialite Elvira, Annie realizes she must return to what is left of her boyhood home in rural North Carolina, in hopes that either her brothers or father can provide the answers she desperately seeks.

Heartbroken and hopeless, he turns to his grandmother and the supernatural world.

More to his confusion, Newman has a strange new affinity towards anything related to boats and the ocean. He feels out of control, defined by a past he can't fully remember, and driven by an obsession he doesn't understand. And just when he's feeling most lost, he thinks he sees the girl from his dreams walking down the street.

title: Life and Death
des: Max Parker, a successful and conceited lawyer had it all - the career, the friends, the mistress - and life was perfect until Death decided to intervene. upon reading Max's dull and meaningless 'life's story' Death sends him a journal which predicts that in the coming days Max will lose the three things he values most before facing Death. In trying to prevent the events from taking place Max comically causes them to happen as predicted. With his materialistic life unraveling Max relies on his ex-secretary, Jane, who devotedly comes to his aid. Now, in the face of Death, Max risks losing the one thing that matter most, and he can only hope it's not too late for another chance at life.

Being the loving husband that he is, Todd bottles up any doubt or concern he might have about her job in order to maintain a happy home. Has being a kindergarten teacher softened Todd up, or is Jackie's career leading them both down a dangerous path?

des: Sci-Fi Short film about a young man, Josh Jacobs, with a very important choice; to save the world or save himself. He meets Avani Johar, a beautiful archaeologist, who does her best to help Josh make the right decision. Together they go on an intellectual roller coaster that pivots around a mystical pan-dimensional alien device found at a Neolithic dwelling site, but who really put it there, and why? Will Josh give in to the evil world of power and greed, or will he save us all? Only time will tell.

title: Ex

Darrow lies to regain her trust and start a new life, but runs into trouble when his past catches up with him. With the police close behind, Darrow must choose to cling to his fantasy life or flee and live to love another day.

title: The Story of Us
des: A suicide love story of sorts. This film uses the idea of suicide to over exaggerate the idea of love blinding us from reality. We do and give up things that we normally would not when in love. When its over the great times over shadow the many bad moments. This story follows the main character, Him, having these great memories of his love. Realizing that he will never find another like her he decides to end it. While in the moment of ending it a reflection of a broken tile reminds him of a fight him and his lover had. This stops him and he starts to remember all these moments that he realizes, was she that great...
cast: Jillian Federman, Brenton Jones

title: Repeat Until

However, this job is actually a cover for her real career as an assassin. One night she attempts to juggle a routine assignment with a blind date. Needless to say, nothing goes quite to plan.

title: Maybe Dreams Can Come True
des: A documentary/narrative film exploring the complex lives of expatriates. The main catalyst (Chocolat) is a young American performer torn between nurturing her love relationship in the USA, while maintaining a booming entertainment career in Europe. The plot evolves into a documentary medium, when Chocolat uses a small video camera as a tool to explore and question her life through interviewing others. Her questions include, why are her friends abroad? And do they intend to return to their native countries? We discover some of the common elements that drew them from their homes: economics, political climates, sexual freedom, and much more. The camera captures amazing performance art lifestyles in the backdrop of all interviews.
cast: Frduah Boateng, Bruce Edwards, Electra Weston, Tonice Weston

title: Product of My Environment
des: From 1972 to 1983 there was a total of 225,020 murders, countless numbers of children have been murdered. It's still going on today, children are murdered, murderers, in prison, in gangs, abused, dropping out of school, shooting up the school, stealing, robbing, homeless, scared, lonely, and crying, wishing someone would help. You don't have to live like this. Your children don't have to live like this. Everyday you wake up, you have a choice, you can change your life. This is the story of a young lady that has gone through more in less than 20 years, than most people would go through in their lifetime. Can she find a way out, is there a way out.

Performed through 'Spoken Word/ Poetry', in the voice of three women, 'Born Again', is a short film, sure to empower, inspire and assist women to break down barriers, from all walks of life.

title: Speed Date
des: A silent, short romantic comedy set in the world of speed dating. An unnamed girl watches herself in the mirror as she gets ready for the 'speed date'. Her hopes and dreams are pinned on this one night. Will she find the man of her dreams or her worst nightmares? And will she come to realize that true love is always in the last place you look? Using music and colour, 'speed-date' weaves together a heartwarming story about finding that special someone who understands us as we truly are. Each character in the story has their own 'song'; a piece of music that represents and defines them. To find true love, the girl must find that special someone whose song 'mashes' with hers to create a new one.

Heartbroken, he will attempt anything to forget the happiness he felt when they were together, or the sadness he is feeling now. His best friend offers that he go and get help form a special psychologist, but at a price. Is it better to have loved and lost, than never to have loved at all? title: Four Sundays in Spring

Believing she's cursed because of past transgressions, she (blackmails) enlists the help of her friends, Stephanie and Shane and her sister, Ivory to help her 'reverse the curse'. During 'Four Sundays In Spring', they undertake a course of events: an Easter Egg hunt, a prom, a visit to a biker bar and culminating into the Memorial Day family cookout. Through all of her antics in the process of trying to find a husband, Jade finds someone more important: herself. Jade's dysfunctional but lovable family provides the comic relief as a backdrop to this romantic comedy.

title: X Ex-Girlfriend

title: Le fils du marchand d'olives
des: For their honeymoon, Anna and Mathieu went to Turkey. With camera in hand, they traced the footsteps of Garabed, the Armenian grand-father of Mathieu, who escape the 1915 genocide. They are determined to learn more about Mathew's Armenian origins. In this country where speaking of the Armenian genocide could be dangerous, their name with Turkish intonations serves a purpose to get people talking about their idea of the Turkish involvement during 1915 tragedy. A road trip across the country mixing animation with documentary, to report a sad confirmation: The denial has become an institution, rewriting the history books and pretending that there was a genocide, but a genocide committed by the Armenians against the Turks.
cast: Jean-Claude Dreyfus

title: On Our Way
des: A chance encounter between two lost souls (Thomas and Anna) leads to a night of unexpected revelations, late night coffee and bottle-smashing. Unfolding over the course of a single night, On Our Way is a hopeful tale of missed connections and second chances. Written and directed by Fergal Rock (Henry & Sunny, Tom Waits Made Me Cry), the film stars Dorothy Cotter (Henry & Sunny, The Savage Eye) and Matthew Keenan (Henry & Sunny, The Tudors, The Clinic). With cinematography by Orla Russell-Conway (Henry & Sunny, Full Circle), the film was produced by Fergal Rock and Noni Stapleton and edited by Nick Callan (Henry & Sunny).
cast: Dorothy Cotter, Matthew Keenan, Tony Leddy, Noni Stapleton

des: Ricky and Christina have been in love for many years. Christina wants to get married. Ricky doesn't. At least not until he loses her. Finding himself without Christina, Ricky embarks on a mission to get her back. With each attempt more outrageous than the last, we inevitably root for Ricky, as he learns what it's like to get rejected.

title: Oh Messy Life

title: Stardust and the Bandit
des: A bookkeeper for the mob is sent by the witness protection program to Old Tucson Movie Studios to hide out. High jinks and romance follow when he is pressed into service as a stunt performer. Then his mobster boss shows up on vacation with his family.

title: Casting Shadows
des: Casting Shadows portrays the internal struggle of a Korean-American woman living in the Californian suburbs. Longing to reconnect with the memory of her mother, Lillian idealizes Korea with an animated fantasy of an ancient folk tale. Her self-imposed isolation during this process in an isolating suburban world distances Lillian from her husband David. Although the already damaged relationship grows increasingly fragile, opening the door to a forgotten history shows Lillian how to tell her own story. She gains a voice as she infuses her relationship with David into her imagination. Lillian learns to explore her desires. Ultimately, the question remains, will rediscovering the past heal the present?
cast: Paget Kagy, Jonathan Le Billon, Micah Maheo, Bo Kyung Park

title: Summers End
des: Summer's End captures the untamed innocence of youth, and its loss of innocence, as Nicholas experiences his first sexual experience, has his first encounter with love, and ultimately confronts true betrayal by someone that he both trusts and loves. The pain of Nicholas' heartache, and the agony of betrayal, explores the competitive and destructive edges of young friendships through the characters of Drew and Nicholas. Nicholas' fear of exploring his romantic feelings as he is forced to confront the betrayal begins his initial steps toward his emotional manhood.
cast: Charles Brice, Madisyn Clark, Kumari D'Shay, Tia Goodson

title: Death of Love
des: The movie is about love, loss, and all the secrets in between. The whole movie takes place on a telephone call between two people. It intertwines memories into visual stories all leading to moments of clarity. It comes down to meeting someone, losing someone else, and all the infidelity in between.
cast: Mike Bergeron, Vanessa Gall, Winter Adams, Rebecca Kearney

title: Cheyenne

Josh, is bruiting after a breakup from his long-time girlfriend, and finds the message in the bottle. He likes what he sees, and sets out to make it his mission to find this girl in a bottle. With his best friend, Kyle, shrugging him aside, he feels like he now has to prove something. After a long climactic talk with his ex, he begins to realize it's a fantasy, and heads back to the beach where it all started.

title: Border of Love
des: Border of Love is a story about a young man just finishing his college career. Looking to make a difference in the world, but not quite sure how to do it. He's presented with the opportunity to help a friend, and after minimal deliberation decides to do it. Not sure of the consequences of his actions, Elliott agrees to help out his friend Dolores by marrying her and helping her gain citizenship. Elliott was not prepared for the trials and tribulations he was to encounter to give Dolores her right of passage to becoming a U.S. Citizen, and inevitably discovering that not all good deeds go unpunished.
cast: Pierre Calderon, Carlina Chacon, Kate Krieger, Aaron Shand

title: Mama Shekinah
des: Colin, born in Bermuda, is feral. Hell deep in a life of drugs, jail, and sexual perversion, Colin falls in love with Hedi, who is hell deep in spiritual perfectionism, legalism and anorexia. They meet at an inner healing school in England. Eventually they marry, and travel throughout East Africa teaching grief and trauma recovery. One year later they are ambushed by child soldiers from the LRA. Colin is killed, and Hedi eventually returns with their two year old daughter to express forgiveness to the children who were abducted by the LRA.
cast: Fawn Parish, Joey Parish

title: Crna ovca bistricka

title: Ciao Chérie
des: Ciao Chérie tells the story of people in a Viennese call shop, of great questions of origin and borders, of the search for closeness and the need for a connection to others. Calls over big distances, remittances to the homeland, the daily routine of the shop - created in a real setting, with laymen and actors, unscripted, improvisational and with pleasure for discovery. It is a film about the possibility of the impossibility of communication between humans and disappointments, hopes and difficulties as a result. A trip around the world in the tone, one space in the image.
cast: Nahoko Fort-Nishigami, Simonida Selimovic, Ayo Aloba, Mahamad Abdiasis

title: My Heaven in You

But Courtney learns that the magic found in a kiss, especially a first kiss, requires a little faith.

The trip should take no more than an hour or two, however things don't go entirely to plan as mechanical faults, family disagreements, missing children, pesky local 'wildlife', unplanned funerals and other unforeseen circumstances stop the bus in its tracks. For Denny and his family, the road to Leongatha becomes a very, very long one.

An original short which distills the eccentricity, adrenaline and glorious awkwardness of falling in love into a fractured medley of memories; memories that fuel One Big Sexy-Sex-Gear-Filled Night for Boy and Girl - reminding us that the biggest moments happen when we're not really looking. The events of the film take place on the off-beat: the scenes crash into life at a humdrum, real-time pace, chopped up by moments of suspended animation when- for Girl and Boy - the rest of the world stops turning altogether.

Combining vérité footage with traditional Jewish songs, Kops' poetry is utilized to delve in and out of indelible moments of his life. Kops' student and mentee, Jill Campbell has created a raw and passionate celebration of this special and last of a dying breed of 'Angry Young Men.' Screened at the JW3 Center London.

Two missionaries pay him a visit, disrupting his comfy suburban existence, throwing into question the whole nature of good and evil. This colourful, larger-than-life comic short challenges fixed notions of morality, as our two men of God look within themselves for what is right and wrong, and find each other.

title: Roehampton Guerrillas (2011-2016)
des: Beg Steal Borrow's William Brown is proud to curate Roehampton Guerrillas (2011-2016), a showcase of short films made by participants in William's Guerrilla Filmmaking class, which he has been teaching at the University of Roehampton, London, since 2011. The class involves students making a series of short films that involve both a technical and a thematic constraint - akin in some respects to Lars von Trier and Jørgen Leth's The Five Obstructions (2003), which is the first film that participants watch as part of the class. The class also invites participants to draw on a history of guerrilla filmmaking from around the world, reading important texts and manifestos by filmmakers like Julio García Espinosa, Fernando E. Solanas and Octavio Getino, Glauber Rocha, Jia Zhangke and Wu Wenguang. Participants also watch and gain inspiration from work by zero- to micro-budget filmmakers like Giuseppe Andrews, Ai Weiwei, Khavn de la Cruz, Mike Ott and Harmony Korine. Roehampton Guerrillas (2011-2016) features 39 short films by 31 different filmmakers, and which respond to eight different challenges set to participants on the course. The films, chosen from among 100s made during the first five years of the Guerrilla Filmmaking course, are all packed in to a 127-minute running time. Short on time, with no technical support, and forced to make films about topics and using techniques that are not of their choosing, the Roehampton Guerrillas prove the following:- You don't need money to make a film. You don't even need a camera. You only need an idea. Limitations do not hinder creativity. They drive it.
cast: Charli Adamson, Alexander Crowe, Josh Fenwick-Wilson, William Guy, Lola Lextrait, Marc Moyce, Lino Negri, Pablo Saura

It's a typical coming-of-age story, with a guy and girl out on their own for the first time, fending for themselves, figuring things out, coming to terms with their sexuality, making sense of God's silence, and making their first fumbling forays into romance. It's a typical coming-of-age story--only this time the fate of the human race is at stake.

The installation is made up of a lights sign which reads 'Feel Me'. Below it there are three boxes with two holes for people to stick their hands inside. Inside each box there is an object relevant to the film. The Wabi Sabi book in Braille. An incense holder filled with ashes. A toy gun. People can't see the objects they can only touch them after which they pass to see the film. The story is a 'coming of age' story based on two people that are departing forever, Ben knows this yet Anna doesn't want to see it.

title: These Lovers
des: For Charlotte, Nora, Brody, August and Anand, love is elusive; either on account of their own desires, fears and struggles or by circumstances beyond their control. A slice of life romantic drama, These Lovers is an honest account of how love shapes our lives, in moments of passion and betrayal, of loss and loneliness from which old flames extinguish and new beginnings unfold. Torn between lovers, Charlotte struggles for freedom from the confines of her ailing Aunt Grace and her responsibilities at the hotel. August and Nora are young dreamers, defying authority in pursuit of their own happiness. Anand longs for adventure, travel and true love, while postponing an arranged marriage and a predetermined future. Brody, a talented musician who spends most of his time traveling, must choose between commitment and the freedom of the open road. For each, an unassuming room at the Hotel Grace is the catalyst for new beginnings but not without consequences that will reverberate throughout their lives.

title: Four Fifteen
des: They were neighbors at birth, friends at 8, and from then on inseparable. All grown up now, Matt, Brian, and Cara haven't missed a beat with their friendship. Corporate life, with a desire for the finer things, keeps Brian in grand pursuit and simultaneously exposes an ever-growing Archilles Heel. While Cara enjoys a comfortable grasp on her life, she's confronted with a realization that's remained hidden for twenty years. Weighed by the strengths of his best friend Brian, and entertained by the childhood antics of his best friend Cara, Matt continues to take life in stride and seek that which consistently remains a mile from his finger tips...or does it? Childhood friendships blossom into adult romance, rivalries, striving and struggle. For Mathew, Brian and Cara, life will steer its own path into a frantic race for redemption, love and money, with good versus apathy playing out in terrifying brilliance.

title: Amore tra le rovine
des: A love letter to early Italian cinema, Love Among the Ruins is a faux documentary about the miraculous discovery and restoration of a long-lost Italian silent film. The genius of the Lumini brothers, two cinematic visionaries almost overlooked in the history of cinema, ignites the imagination of a contemporary filmmaker who makes the discovery of a lifetime. In 2012, a 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck northern Italy, severely affecting the historic city of Ferrara and surrounding areas and causing significant damage to the region's Medieval and Renaissance architecture. However, a cracked wall in Ferrara's municipal building revealed a hidden treasure: several cans of old film. Could this be the long-lost silent romance written and directed by the Lumini brothers of Ferrara in the early 1920s? Can the deteriorated film be repaired so new audiences around the world can enjoy this moving story of lovers caught in the events of World War I? Scholars speculate, experts and archivists hypothesize, and finally, the 90-year old film is restored and set to a new musical score. The talents of actors long passed away (or maybe not!) and the beauty of Ferrara in the 1920s (as well as today) are once again seen on the screen with a tale as striking and poignant for today's viewers as it was nearly a century ago.
cast: Alexander la Rue, Stefano Muroni, Mary Di Tommaso, Edoardo Siravo

title: The Moment You Realize
des: Suicide among LGBT youth is extremely prominent in our current society, with suicide rates on the rise. This short film centres around the attempted suicide of the character Heath who is sent to the hospital for a psychological evaluation and must face his biggest challenge. Coming to terms with his sexuality. This short film depicts how the LGBT community and its youth continually struggle for acceptance and tolerance within the context of sexual awareness. Knowing oneself and staying true to who you are is the running theme of this film. Understanding that love should never be questioned but cherished and admired. We hope that this short film brings awareness and education for the LGBT youth who feel so ostracized that suicide becomes there only escape.

title: It Seems to Hang On
des: It Seems to Hang On is based on the true story of the serial killers Alton Coleman and Debra Brown, a young Black couple who cut a violent path beginning in the summer of 1984 through the American Midwest (Ohio, Kentucky, Michigan, Indiana, Illinois and Wisconsin). The dialogue spoken in the film is inspired and based on lyrics from the American soul duo (and couple) Ashford and Simpson's 1979 hit song "It Seems to Hang On". The lyrics refer to a couple struggling to hang on or to be together thought adversity. Filmmaker Kevin Jerome Everson's strategy was to make a film about a desperate, violent but loving couple on the run from the law. The film was shot in and around the city of Detroit, and area where Coleman and Brown committed several murders. Their crimes were horrific, and their victims were Black with the exception of one white woman, a murder that eventually led to Coleman's conviction and execution. Alton Coleman was executed in 2002. Debra Brown is doing life in a prison in Indiana. Coleman was born in 1956 in Waukegan, Illinois near Wisconsin. Debra Brown was born in 1962 in Ohio. There is no current documentation on how they met.
cast: Lynnette R. Freeman, Ricky Goldman

Though the journalist finishes his work by next morning, but finds out that his wife has died in her sleep, and now regrets, realizing that no success is worth being obsessive about if in the end, one does not have a loved one to share it with. title: Life Changes
des: Hidden in forgotten corners of Palm Beach County, Florida, an epidemic rages with young teens having babies. Almost all mothers are minorities. All are poor. Not one teen mother planned to get pregnant. Invariably, the baby was 'an accident,' or 'it just happened,' or 'it wasn't his/her fault.' The one constant is that none of these girls could survive on their own. 'Life changes' follows four girls from pregnancy to their child's third birthday. One girl got pregnant at 12, another at 13, and two at 16. The younger girls are Latina, and the older girls are African-American and Haitian.

title: Meet Me on Saturday in...
des: A six part mini-series written by Michael J. Wood-Wilson: Meet Me on Saturday in... Kentish Town, London (Episode 1) Camden Town, London (Episode 2) Lewisham, London (Episode 3) Blackheath, London (Episode 4) Greenwich, London (Episode 5) Richmond, London (Episode 6) 'Meet Me on Saturday in...' is a contemporary love story with traditional themes, involving a young man from north London, Ben, and a young woman from south London, Amy. Each short episode is set in a different part of London that has featured strongly in their lives at some point. The mini-series is also part-autobiographical and an expression of the director's love of these six London districts, and more widely for London itself. After each episode Ben or Amy's 30 second voiceover briefly explains the district's origins and the reason for its name - three places are Ben's favourites, three are Amy's.

In this unofficial and very exaggerated autobiography told by Peter Williams himself, we are introduced to his world through his eyes, live and on stage. Now she must do her best to show just enough interest in the other losers around to appease the folks while still having time to chase after all the attractive guys in the MC's afterschool group, which just so happens to be a group for chronically unfriendable people.

Which isn't helped by the fact that her house mate seems to be able to make a physical relationship possible regardless of the situation. How will Claire keep her man, when she seems to be the only one unable to make Skype work for her? Or will it be Ben who truly finds the physicality the hardest part to over come.

title: A Good Man
des: Star and Jamie are having a typical candlelit date when she walks into the bathroom, her makeup smudged from crying. Jamie notes this but doesn't ask what's wrong. As we learn more about the young couple, Star begins to tell her boyfriend the story of how her great-grandparents fell in love. The lines between past and present are blurred in this film with a reference to the charter of values affecting present-day Quebec politics when Nicholas, Star's great-grandfather, is seen meeting Mary upon his arrival to Montreal, as a lonely Italian immigrant during the Great Depression. Their first meeting, their first dance, are all told in contrast to Star, who is in the middle of producing a film of her own. Yet when a strange event occurs as Jamie and Star are on their way to the set, she realizes there may be a touch of fate on her current work.

This crazy idea brings together a bunch of old friends and Mausams tells the story of this motley bunch as they cross each others paths over the days that build up to the play. The film follows a simple point of view. Like Mausams or Seasons, things always change. It is not always bright and sunny. It is not always cold and chilly. But with some initiative, loads of optimism and a little bit of luck, you can still manage to smile no matter what season you are in.

title: Vices: Part One

One night, after having too much to drink, he dreams that the ghost of a famous writer stops him from committing suicide. The writer convinces him that he must take risks in his everyday life in order to have a proper inspiration for his writing. He wakes up with a new sort of optimism. For inspiration, he decides to got a party with Ava. The party does not turn out to be what Javier expected. Two robbers in masks break into the house, and capture Ava. Javier's world becomes the drama he wants to write about.

title: Saturday Stroll
des: Saturday Stroll is a love story between three protagonists: the status-seeking, twenty-something Sam, her canine companion and true love, Booboo, and her boyfriend, Charlie. Sam wants a guy on her arm; Charlie wants regular sex, now only offered in small, conditional doses. The film, shot from Charlie's perspective, provides a snapshot of the seminal moment in Sam and Charlie's relationship when harsh reality displaces their 'honeymoon' fantasies. The original soundtrack assumes Charlie's emotions as he wavers from enthusiasm, to disappointment, to blaring noise in order to drown-out his girlfriend's verbal tirade. How Sam and Charlie will proceed together is the eternal question facing most couples at the moment when lust and desire evolves to the truth and consequences inherent in all relationships between two lovers.

After a heated argument about Ash's selfishness, Carrie leaves him finding solace in his turbulent group of friends lead by the charismatic and angry Sam. When his long-time but distant friend Mike tries to talk some sense into him, Ash knows he needs to turn his life around, and goes out to try and correct his previous transgressions, but still can't envision his life without Carrie. However, Ash's past mistakes could be his ultimate downfall.

title: Over 90 & Loving It
des: Over 90 and Loving It is a documentary about people in their 90s and 100s living extraordinary and passionate lives in every way. These are people who aren't aware of chronological age at all, but live as though the future and youth spring eternal, writing, marrying, getting a degree, putting on concerts, working full-time, as starters. Putting it succinctly, one says, 'You can drive yourself nuts worrying about something you can't do anything about, getting older, but you sure can be exhilarated about living.' Over 90 and Loving It will inspire people all across the age spectrum. We all need heroes and heroines to emulate and this film will reach the hearts and minds of all of us who want to have a full life.
cast: Fan Benno-Caris, Katie Brown, Fran Cowan, Marlow Cowan

title: Yesterday

Even though Nilofar is in love with Maiwand, she is against getting married to him due to their age gap. Maiwand is madly in love with Nilofar, he believes age shouldn't restrict anyone from falling in love, the only thing that matters is for two souls to be together. Maiwand's grandfather is supporting his love for Nilofar. His feral childish emotions annoy Nilofar. She resents at first, but gradually the she becomes his friends. Maybe, because of her loneliness and lack of confidence, she starts liking the young man, or perhaps the young man who has missed the motherly love feels secure with Nilofar, but in any event his grandfather is a hero in the eyes of Maiwand. He is a symbol of wisdom and astuteness in his thoughts. As the days pass their love becomes more mature, but they are badly teased by their classmates. The story goes to different phases to explain their emotions, until the graduation night. And then that worse incident happens at that night and they lose each other forever. Maybe yesterday was a better day for Maiwand, but yesterday will never comes back again.

title: Extending the Play
des: EXTENDING THE PLAY is not about basketball. It is a unique story about redemption, opportunity, passion, love, humility and the trials and tribulations that arise while chasing a dream. The story examines the lives of Kasey and Bracey Ulin, a husband and wife who are currently two of the top basketball players in Luxembourg. Coming from opposite coasts in the USA, they both have intriguing individual journeys leading up to their introduction in 2007 while playing in Germany. They have went through some major conflicts since meeting, even finding themselves away from basketball during the prime of their careers. But since, have returned overseas to finish off their amazing storybook careers. Currently, Kasey seems to be getting better with age. He is the leader of his team and a mentor to the younger players. But at 31, he knows the end of his career could be approaching quicker than he'd like. Bracey plays a similar role on her team. She gets better and better every season, but cannot help to get excited about starting a life after basketball. They live a very unique life in Europe. One that many people would find interesting. This documentary will tell the very unique story of how they got to where they are, what everyday life is like for this type of life, and will answer the question of how long they will want to keep Extending the Play.

title: Exit 91 Summerland
des: EXIT 91 SUMMERLAND is a low budget love story/ ghost story, about a fun loving your couple starring fresh faced- Megan Dewitt and Curtis( Josh Pomer) . The story begins with the couple who want to get away from the town that they live in Wyoming and experience something that they have never seen before. They land on a town called Summerland California, and proceed to make their way there in Curtis's 1970 Black Lincoln Continental Coupe. They then move in and start to discover that they have essentially moved into a apartment that has dark secrets and they slowly become possessed by the spirits of Summerland.

title: First Kiss
des: Cash thinks Jer is lame, and decides to drag him to a party in order for him to loosen up a bit. Jer doesn't want to go at all but goes anyway. Tara doesn't want to go to the party but is dragged by her friend, Stacey. At the party, Jer meets Tara and they connect due to their hatred for the party. Dodging out on the crowd in the hopes for some quiet and perhaps a cigarette, Jer and Tara venture upstairs to the roof. They enjoy each others company and exchange some witty banter. There's a connection. They kiss. Awkward. All teeth and tongue. They blame each other. The argument gets bitter quickly and they decide to return to the party. The door is locked. They continue to argue and Jer loses his credit card in the door trying to open it. Jer's constant attempts to open the door and Tara's conscience get the better of her and she decides that it would be a good idea if they kissed again. The two agree but Jer can't get over his stage fright. Jer asks Tara to slap him as a way to get him over his fear. Tara eventually slaps him after Jer's goading. It hurts. They kiss again. Before they can get the door open Cash and Stacey bust through it intent on hooking up. Jer and Tara, after assurance from their friends, leave to go to the bar, accidentally locking Cash and Stacey on the roof.

title: The Marriage of the Thames and the Rhine

Central characters in the narrative are Hermes, in the form of a seal, and Pegasus the mythological horse, both bearing witness to the voyage of the imagination, unhindered by the straight jacket of history and time. The animation has a dual meaning; it is both symbolic meditation on a journey into the unknown through the eyes of Pegasus and the seal, both hoping to heal wounds and create a sense of unity in their universe and also an exploration of the geographical history of the Thames and Rhine, which 10,000 years ago formed one single river.

cast: Madison Lee, Carly Rosenbaum, Dillon Seals

title: Not So Far from Perfect
des: Four friends gather for some wine and conversation and the topic changes to the what makes up the perfect date. Everyone has their own idea of the qualities that make up Mr. Perfect as well as what would make the perfect date, so sit back and watch as these friends construct him and the date from scratch.
cast: Margie L. Brewer, Flavia Covino, Kelli Cayman Cozlin, Dawn Davis

title: Be Still
des: A lonely photographer tries to win back the love of his life by asking her to accompany him on a photo shoot.
cast: Michael Godere, Anjanette Hall, Clarke Thorell, Marilyn Carino

title: The Smile Behind the Mirror
des: What if you could relive the best part of your life forever?
cast: Omar Ahmadein, Fred Almengor, Sarah Barnette, David Burgos

title: Honor Your Revenge
des: After witnessing the death of his father at the hands of his ex-girlfriend Daphne and new boyfriend Cypar, Ion must chase down the murderous duo and decide what is the best revenge.
cast: Schafer Bourne, Steve Helms, Amanda Johnson, Stephen Perry

title: A Plush Life
des: Tommy, in the throes of a confidence crisis, dons a panda suit that wins him back his mojo, but may lose him his wife.
cast: Justin Lee Baldwin, Wayne DeBary, Scott Mock, Brittany Morrill

title: Dylan and Michelle
des: Dylan and Michelle is a story that takes place somewhere between the conscious and unconscious, between 4am and sunrise, between rekindling an old flame and a fresh start.
cast: Pheby Lumbera, Allie Rivera

title: Voodoo
des: A long distance couple send each other a voodoo doll in order to enjoy a magical massage, but then a misunderstanding leads to violent escalation.
cast: Ian Mairs, Sesselia Olafs

title: Blind Date
des: Two people on a blind date, in a restaurant they can't see eat in the dark. They develop chemistry. They exit. Will they live up to expectations?
cast: Henry Eastwood, Jennifer McEwen, Beatrice Reitano

title: Miser's Dream
des: A passionate, but unsuccessful, magician meets an insecure loner trapped in a privileged life. They run away together to become a performing duo, but when their rivalry threatens their lucrative partnership, they need to figure out whether they're better together or apart.
cast: Avita Jay, Chris O'Mara, Liam A. Black, Karen Elliot

title: Blue Moon
des: A young man named Andreas is unable to come to terms with the death of his girlfriend, despite his friends' efforts. One day, he receives a visit that will change his perspective.
cast: Dimitris Koustolidis, Maria Stefanidou, Stylian Senar, Andriana Avraam

title: Another Man
des: This film tells the story of a man looking back on his life with regret for letting love and the past diminish the passion he once had for his dreams.
cast: Eli Wills, Brett Hargrave, Darrell Salk, Margaret Bicknell

title: The Dawn of a New Day
des: A South African plastic surgeon, Dr, Tertius Venter, wants to leave his private practice to join a hospital ship providing free surgeries to the poor - but at a personal cost his wife Trudi may not be willing to pay. She is devastated at the realization she would only see him three months a year. While Tertius wrestles between being with the woman he has always loved and his destiny, the documentary closely follows Ambroise (32), Hyacinthe (10) and Fadila (11) who are three West Africans in need of life-changing surgery but without access to health care.
cast: Ryley Grunenwald

title: What We Have Here
des: Late at night, seventeen-year-old Adrian is discovered by his mother in bed with the girl he's been seeing, Maria. She swiftly kicks the duo out of the house, prompting the two teens to wander the streets trying to figure out a place to spend the night.
cast: Julie Antti, Emma Ivet, Peyton James, Ben Rotenberg

title: Hold My Hand: Altair & Vega
des: Based on the popular Durjoy Datta novel Hold my Hand, this short film tells the story of an Indian romance in Hong Kong. Against a series of stunning Hong Kong backdrops, the filmmakers bring this touching story of a young couple from the page to the screen, evoking the beautiful story of Deep and Ahana, and the romantic ambience of Hong Kong. The film won a competition organized by Whistling Woods International film school.
cast: Nakul Sahdev, Lianne Texeira

title: Bristles
des: Tainted goods and frayed toothbrushes - newlyweds Lilly and Lisle try to save their clumsy, un-Hollywood, unglamourous love.
cast: Zoe Cunningham, Alexander Devrient, Tina Harris, Noor Lawson

title: Darling Memories
des: The market for ornamental figurines is tanking, and there's only one person who can save Darling Memories: Ben Hardwicke, with his idea for a new line of gay-themed dolls. But Ben's big investor meeting is threatened by his pissed-off boyfriend back home.
cast: Elijah Allred, Nathan Brumbaugh, David Harper, Garry Peters

title: Little Things
des: Add a Plot
cast: Chris Jones, Richie Nolan, Lisa Solari

title: Let's Be Out, The Sun Is Shining
des: A film about a shy Indian-American receptionist named DIYA with romantic notions of love who falls in love with a charismatic but arrogant Brooklyn bartender PADDY to whom everyone is disposable and no relationship is meant to last. When Paddy rejects Diya for another woman, Diya immerses herself in his world of struggling actors and musicians who live potentially displaced in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Though Diya's protective older brother and uncle do not understand her need to "change the pattern" of her life, the magnetism and passion of this new circle of friends teaches Diya a few important lessons about lust, love and staying true to oneself.
cast: Lipica Shah, Scott Lyman, Angela Gulner, Madeleine James

title: Two Birds
des: Ellie and Rose like each other. Like the fall in love, and go on dates, and sail across the ocean on a yacht and stare into the other eyes kind of like. The only problem is that they have never met, even though they both frequent the same coffee shop. The question is - who will make the first move?
cast: Charlotte Arnoux, Kea Trevett

title: Draw a Dream
des: Dylan is a painter who discovers that his dreams control a certain woman's fate. While he tries to break the connection between them, a beautiful relationship is born.
cast: Nicholas Downs, Lindsay Heath

title: Flowers
des: Rob is successful, handsome and funny. His career as a photographer is going well and life could be really good. If he could only find the girl of his dreams. The ongoing frustration of how hard it is to meet new and interesting women in one of the biggest cities in the world is getting to him. He has met all his friends' single female friends and feels as though he is running out of options. All of this is compounded by the fact that he is trying to ignore that he is in love with his best mate's girlfriend.
cast: Emily Butterfield, James Carcaterra, Jamie Champion, Polly Eachus
